name: Mendenhall Glacier Visitor Center
address: 6000 Glacier Spur Rd, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Very informative visitors center with excellent views of the glacier.  Videos showing melting of the glacier over the years and other glacier info.  Specimens of local wildlife on display.  Nice little gift shop.  Clean restrooms.  Well-informed rangers give short presentations and answer questions. Completely disabled accessible,  with captioned videos,  and an elevator from the lower level.  Highly recommended!

Go see it while it's still there! Climate change is destroying this glacier. The staff and viewing areas are really amazing. They provide telescopes and knowledge about the area. They also have videos and interactive displays. If you hike the area you'll be able to see all the places the glacier used to be, and you can take really nice shots all around the area. They have live salmon spawning in the area, and other wildlife. It's very untouched by man. Very wonderful experience.

Get ready for crowds! It’s a great starting point to find out more about the park and local trails.  The rangers were helpful. The gift shop was small, but adequate. 

If you are trying to get your Junior Ranger badge make sure you download the Agents of Discovery Badge app first.

Beautiful site, informative ranger, and well maintained.  I enjoyed our brief stop here at the visitors center after walking out to Nugget Falls and getting a closer view of the glacier. I recommend stopping at the visitors center before the hike, however it was nice to stop in and warm up afterward.

Very nice trails and guest center. I found the map of how the glacier has receded and formed new bodies of water and the salmon birth/death route exhibit the most fascinating. Highly recommend going there if you're in the area. Lots of small plane flights to see from the sky too closer in town, but we didn't do that.

name: Alaska Zipline Adventures
address: 76 Egan Dr UNIT 100, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Are zip line guides Julian and Hannah were great and very professional. they were also friendly and very safety conscious. we had a member of our group who is extremely nervous and they were able to work with him so that everyone had a great time.

It's a fun experience. The guides were wonderful.
I just imagined it will be more time zipping....
It was 4 ziplines and one bridge to walk.
The thing was that each zipline lasted about 10 seconds.... and waiting was very long time.
I expected to be more time in the air...
I guess that for people that it is their first time it will not be dissapointing as for me.

I loved every minute. Guides were fantastic. Andrew was phenomenal. I want you to know I accidentally dropped my phone in the van on way back to ship and as I was frantically looking for it in my backpack at the drop off here he comes in the van. He came back to bring me my phone. Thank you Andrew. I will never forget you.
This excursion was amazing!!  Julianne and Andrew were so much fun!  Knowledgeable, funny, and nothing but smiles!!
This was the highlight of our Alaskan cruise!  Best zipline experience we've had.  Incredible views and great staff.

name: Alaska State Museum
reviews: Very elegant display in the rugged setting of Juneau.  The history on display is unique to the natives of Alaska and additionally introduces the fishing industry and how it has revolutionized salmon processing in the port communities.  I included some snaps of the lovely gift shop as well.
I'm from Juneau and really impressed with the new Museum. It's really great to have to teach people about the state, it's indigenous peoples and history. Strongly recommend a visit.
A beautiful place to learn about the last frontier.
One of the best state history museums I've ever seen...and I'm a certified historian.
Many good artifacts

name: Glacier Gardens Rainforest Adventure
reviews: Beautiful gardens and tour but the only downside is they don't give you time to take photos along the way on the tour. They take you through the park in a covered, open on the sides "stretch golf cart" type of vehicle, but they don't tell you that it's just to give you an initial overview of the property, and not meant to be a photo opp tour. At the end of the tour, we were told we had all day to take photos and walk the grounds but it's a long way and very steep. I guess it would have been fine if we would have planned our time accordingly and knew to make a day trip of hiking out of it, but we didn't know this ahead of time. Otherwise, great tour and gardens.

Simply beautiful with stunning views of the harbor. 

Upside down trees with planted flowers are unique and you can tell that the owner, Steve, puts his heart and soul into the property. It must be contagious because all of the staff seem excited to be there, it truly shoes.

Fabulous place to visit. Rainforest, botanical gardens and views. Excellent guides with knowledgeable and passionate narration. And to top it all - an eagle's nest with two nearly mature young. Like I said - fabulous!!

Nice facility. Had a tram ride through the rainforest. Stopped at an observation platform 500+ feet above sea level. Saw several eagles. The "upside down" trees were very interesting. Beautiful showcase of the forest. Visitor center has a small gift shop and offers drinks and snacks for sale. There are tables and chairs available in a covered area.

The story behind this garden is what makes it amazing.  The owner is also the gardener and creator of everything you see. His heart is everywhere you look as you tour this beautiful garden.  There were also Eagle chicks just born in a nest on his site. He has developed a true haven and natural habitat for the plants and animals.

name: Tongass National Forest
reviews: All I can say is that you wont be disappointed, terrific flora and fauna and fantastic views. Dont miss it as it is very convenient to Tacoma and probably one of the great local and tourist spots in WA state.
Such a beautiful place. Such a shame that our President just signed a paper allowing his rich friends to cut it down. Please take a stand and call your Congressman.

Peaceful and stunning. We took the cable car into the lower regions and used leg power to ascend. This was summer 2019 and weather was warm and welcoming. We stalked an eagle and got up close and personal. Beautiful area.
Wonderful walk through the forest.  Peaceful definitely a place you should visit at least once in your life.

This place is special to my heart. It’s purely gods country no doubt in my mind. Respect it and keep it clean. The most sacred place on earth. It’s the last quiet place on the planet. Everything feels alive within.

name: National Shrine of St. Therese
reviews: Marvelous location! Constructed in 1938, this somewhat isolated peaceful chapel / shrine commemorates Saint Theresa. It is located outside Juneau with easy access from the Main road. There are cabins of various sizes to rent on the compound for family or groups to rent. Absolutely amazing scenery!
The cabins are incredible, peaceful and cozy.  Everything is very well taken care of.  It's a great place to get away from it all for a few days.
So spiritual, so beautiful, view is one of the best, and the community built labyrinth was lovely.
Beautiful place! Kind of creepy, and has a weird feel to the inside of it, but still a must see for Juneau. I go to the Shrine often.

Absolutely beautiful place to visit.  Plan to stay a while, there is lots to see and enjoy.  The church is small but very charming.  The lookout is amazing.  A great place to whale watch at the right time.  The whole environment is peaceful and inviting.  Highly recommended!

name: Juneau-Douglas City Museum
reviews:
Small but interesting. Went after the summer season so white empty and things the chat with the staff a little... Very warm and enjoyed chatting.
Enjoyed the interactive opportunities for children.
Wonderful little museum. We found pictures of our ancestors that attended Douglas High school. They brought up annuals from storage for us to look through.
Cute small museum way up on the hill. Not a Nessesary attraction but cute and fun.
Small museum with history of the city. If you have time to spare, it's worth the trip. Otherwise, I would rather visit the Capitol building next door

Quaint and highly educational City Tours Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays from 1:30-3:00 P.M. (May-September). Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Small, well curated museum. Great for the whole family. Trendy gift shop with interesting local art, books, and gifts.

name: Point Bridget State Park
reviews: Great hike/walk. It was easy, and really nice!
Beautiful Mendenhall Glacier. Also visited Nugget Falls. Very nice walking trails and gorgeous views.

Point Bridget State Park was created in 1988 as a gorgeous "state park for the state capital." There are year-round trails for hiking and cross country skiing, as well as fishing and boating opportunities. Three public-use cabins are available for rent, one of which (Blue Mussel Beach Cabin) affords breathtaking views of Berners Bay, where marine birds, whales, seals, and Steller's sea lions abound. Not to be missed!!!
It's absolutely gorgeous on the trail and getting to the beach side is worth the hike the view is amazing
Good hiking spot, trails were improved last summer.

name: Juneau's Best Tours
address: 230 S Franklin St #906, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: This was an awesome trip.  The float plane tour was informative and interesting and not as loud as u would think but was very hot.  The food was delicious  and the people nice.  Definitely worth the money and time.  The black  ears was an unexpected  bonus.  We saw 3 ranging in size.
Who does not love a glacier?
Awesome glacier and waterfall. Take time to hike it if you can. Hike is well marked and easy to follow.
This was a great stop during our cruise.
Great stop

name: Last Chance Mining Museum
reviews: Preserved bit of history. A long but beautiful walk from town if you are up to it. You get a good picture of what it was like for the miners.
This was a fun little last minute adventure we took. The kids loved it!  The views alone are worth it
Quick walk through an old mining building with artifacts.  $5 tix per person, but justifiable since it goes to a good cause.
Different. Don't bring toddlers- too many safety issues. Not a handicap friendly location. More for able bodied adults.
Historic mine.  You can pan for gold like the old prospectors did during the Alaskan gold rush

name: Eagle Beach
reviews: First time to Eagle Beach during the winter (really my first time to Juneau at all) and we had a blast. It was beautiful during sunset and enjoyed playing with pieces of ice washed up on shore. It was like I was a kid again!

Great location for a quick getaway from the busy city life. About 35min from downtown offering  solitude and gorgeous views with covered picnic areas, grills and public restrooms. Bring water and firewood and something to throw on the grill and you will have a fantastic time camping for free or just spend your day in the last frontier.
Beautiful beach for a picnic or walking. Excellent wildlife viewing. Ample parking and everything was clean. An easy drive from downtown. Eagles and bears are very frequent sightings here.
Beautiful day for a dig walk at Eagle Beach.
Very quiet walk, enjoyed. Did not see many eagles

name: Aj Mine Gasteneau Mill Tours
address: 500 Sheep Creek Mine Rd, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: This place has history and adventure to share with everybody. The people that share there experiences were the workers from that mine. Is been talked that they want to invest on it to re-open it and continue exploiting it. The owner of the place is the one that you can find on the souvenir shop. Get some souvenirs and enjoy the tour.!

This is an amazing tour! The underground portion shows how gold was mined in the 1800s, how technology improved the process in 1930, and again in 1980. The above ground portion showed methods used to remove gold from the ore, and gave us a chance to pan for gold.
It was fun to see how gold was mined years ago. Worth the time spent!
Great experience en great guides that explained their daily life in the mine.

Came here while in town on a cruise ship in Juneau and had a great time.  Fun little mine tour.  At the end they teach you to pan for gold from the tailings from the mine and you get to keep the gold! I got like 10 flecks and was stoked on it!

name: Wings Airways & the Taku Glacier Lodge
reviews: Amazing excursion out of Juneau! Combine the seaplane with the lodge at the glacier and it’s hard to surpass this travel experience! Thanks to Bruce our skillful and friendly pilot and the staff at Taku Lodge. The scenery of the flight is a must of any Alaska trip. The remoteness, scenery and food at the lodge were amazing. The lodge staff prepared salmon on an open grill (afterwards a juvenile bear climbed in the fire pit to eat salmon flavored sand) which was delicious along with rice, beans, slaw and amazing bread and the best ginger cookies I’ve ever had. They offer a full but limited bar as well, a fun gift shop and a short guided hike to a water fall. The staff at the lodge were so friendly, thank you for a great experience and kudos to the chef! Sit down in a chair there and enjoy the view and fresh air:)
Second visit there. I love it here. Very peaceful when the planes have left. Staff are awesome. Scenery is gorgeous. If you’re lucky the bears will come out for photos. I highly recommend this place.

Best excursion of the trip! Starting out with the sea plane over and the tour of the glaciers to the incredible food and having it cooked fresh on an open fire to the nature walk around the property; worth every penny and then some!

This was by far the best excursion I took! The flight over the glaciers was awesome, they are incredibly beautiful, and their expanse has to be seen to be fully appreciated. Taku Lodge is lovely, and the meal was fabulous. The bear, Lois, who came to clean up the grill, was one of the high points. The walk afterwards is recommended but bug spray is a must!! The mosquitos are HUGE and swarm in numbers beyond belief. The grounds are very scenic, and the staff both at the lodge, and at Wings, is terrific. I HIGHLY recommend!

Our pilot's name was Bruce. He made us feel safe and showed us so many beautiful sites. He was the nicest man, and if we ever get the chance to fly with Wings Airways again, we would request Bruce as our pilot. He pointed out many different points of interest to make sure we would see them and get pictures of them. We are so grateful for the opportunity we had and that Bruce was our pilot.

name: Capitol Building
reviews:
This is the Alaska Capital Building in all its Glory. More recent renovations added some phenomenal art work. It really is a museum in many respects. There is a lot of Alaska history on the walls and they do tours on Monday through Friday during normal business hours
. I had the opportunity to tour the building with my Boy Scouts recently. It was a phenomenal tour the was very interesting and educational. A must visit!

There was not a tour guide nor was there a self guided tour pamphlet that we could find. This makes it harder to understand exactly what is what there and why things are they way they are. I have toured several other state capitol buildings so I understood a bit more. It was interesting to see the difference in Alaska's capitol building versus other states. This could be a quick stop or a long tour after 2 floors things start to look similar. You can look online to see if the are in session during your visit. Definitely worth a quick visit though!
The Capitol is such a beautiful place!!! It's one of my favorite places to visit in Alaska.
The building was great. I saw Senate Lyman F. Hoffman.
This place is usually open to the public and is a fun stop while here on a cruise.

name: Saint Nicholas Russian Orthodox Church
reviews: Worth a quick walk up the hill and only a (almost flat) block from the capitol building. Interesting architecture, they have tours 12-5 Monday to Saturday as long as they have volunteers to tour the inside but still worth a look at the outside even if you can't get there during tour hours. Volunteer that we met was super nice!

Nice little church with unusual architecture. Worth having a look during a visit to Juneau. If you are lucy and can get a look inside, make sure you do it with some sensitivity to those who may members of the community there.
This church is so aesthetically pleasing that I've decided to convert to Russian Orthodox, effective immediately.
Very nice little church, over 100 years old. They have a nice little memorial for the interned citizens of Alaska from the second world war.
If you have the time, it is worth the walk up the hill. Very pretty church. They were closed by the time we arrived but still was very pretty.

name: Eaglecrest Ski Area
address: 3000 Fish Creek Rd, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Love that they are doing what they can with little or no snow before Christmas . The new bar has a beautiful wooden counter and bar lady is nice . Also the have a new lift called black bear .
Runs were groomed and well marked, friendly chairlift staff and lesson instructors. Kids had a blast!

Best ski resort in the USA. For more detail, honestly with the limited resources given, and weird snow patterns in SE Alaska, Eaglecrest offers world class terrain that's right under a freaking lift, and so much more within crazy easy hiking and skinning range!
I didn't ski here, but I did do the zip line course and it was a blast.  The 2 guides working with our group were fun and entertaining while also making sure that safety was 100% in mind.
Amazing ski area

name: Mendenhall Wetlands State Game Refuge
reviews: Mendenhall Wetlands is definitely a beautiful place to see. Recommend taking bug repellent with you in the summertime.
Well-managed excellent trails. Spectacular views and lots of wildlife. Black bears feeding on salmon, numerous bald eagles, large porcupines lush green girls and flowers.
Gorgeous sunrise... the mountains lit up beautifully!!
Beautiful place open to the public.  You can see all types of birds.  A lot of eagles in this area. Bring a camera
Easy walking trail with beautiful views of glaciers and mountains. My two year old enjoyed the plane and helicopter fly overs.

name: Treadwell Mine Historic Trail Walking Tour
reviews: Easy trail with access to Sandy Beach.  Live the historic plaques, wish there were more!  Many good spots to read - bring a book!

Located just over the bridge from Juneau on Douglas Island, the trail follows the shore just inside the tree line. Wide mostly gentle walk path commemorates the once large gold mining industry. There are points of interest along the way where the miners onced worked and played. There is also a beach area where you can watch various ships, including cruise liners coming and going from Juneau.

While we did not actually do the trail, we did walk up to the entrance of one of the abandoned none shaft entrances. As you walk towards it the temperature drops and you can feel the rush of cold mountain air got you as you advance. Hopefully I'll be able to go back and hike the trail, but there were many locals there saying it's a very nice trail walk.
Very Interesting History and a peaceful walk. Highly recommend to anyone. Easy trail for young and old alike.
It's very well done, making a maintained feature out of a bunch of ruins that could have been otherwise forgotten.

name: Patsy Ann Statue
reviews: A must stop in Juneau for any dog lover is to pay homage to Patsy Ann, she was and continues to be the "Official Greeter of Juneau". While deaf from birth, Patsy Ann had the ability to 'hear' steamship whistles and never failed to greet a ship. Patsy Ann died in 1942 but her presence is still here in this statue. Visitors are encouraged to "greet her and touch her and in leaving, carry with you the blessings of friendship through your life's journey." Thanks Patsy Ann!

The statue commemorates the local dog, Patsy Ann. The story goes that she was a local dog that preferred to roam around the town, than be at home with her owner. She became a welcome and popular fixture around the city. 

Patsy Ann had the ability to know when the steamship was about to arrive, running down to the dock to wait long before anyone else knew a ship was coming. 

This statue sits next to the cruise ships, so  you should pass it to or from the ship. Her nose shows signs of rubbing, so giver her a pat when you go past.
Friendly  visual history of one of juneau's favorite citizens
Kewl story
A surreal and serene place for photography. If you're lucky, you get Orcas and Humpbacks swim closeby.

name: Liquid Alaska Tours
reviews: Ryan and Spencer were very knowledgeable, professional and really fun tour guides. They were full of facts about the lake and glacier and also shared many funny jokes on the canoe to and from the glacier. This really helped us forget we were paddling 2.5 miles one way. Being able to hike on the glacier is a once in a lifetime experience, well worth every penny. Will recommend this to everyone I know travelling to Juneau.

Absolutely terrific experience, on a group canoe adventure on Mendenhall Lake.  I don’t usually warm up to guided excursions but these guys did everything right.  Quality gear, awesome included snacks, great equipment and very personable, prompt and trustworthy staff!

The excursion I went on was canoeing to and then walking on the Mendenhall Glacier in Juneau, Alaska. Our tour was led by Ryan and Grant in the first week of June, who were both very knowledgeable and funny. Ryan, in particular, has a fun-loving spirit that was infectious. They kept saying how perfect a day we were having in terms of temperature, weather, and wind. And it was certainly great. On the hour-long, single large canoe ride over there were great views of Nugget Falls and Thunder Mountain. The guides had lots of information about the local wildlife, other trips/hikes, the timeline of the retreat of the glacier, and other notable tidbits.

Getting in and out of the canoe was easy and the tour provided absolutely everything you'd need or want. Anyone who is not in bad shape would be able to do this tour fairly easily. There is walking with some elevation involved.

We walked up to the glacier over a rocky moraine and put the crampons on. I had no issues whatsoever with slipping with these on. Saw all the notable features that were accessible that day, the glacier changes constantly. But just being up there and on it, seeing the vastness out before you was worth it on its own.

Grant was nice enough to get me a bottle full of glacier run-off water which I still have (thanks to checked luggage). I hope Ryan has upgraded his own glacier water's container by now. To cap things off, on the boat ride back, we got an extended close-up view of the porcupine that lives on an outcropping of land. My first one I've seen in the wild. Finished up with some hot cocoa back at the van. Great day.

Excellent experience! Our guides Casey and Joey were friendly and knowledgable. The canoe trips out and back went quickly, and our guides did a nice job pointing out noteworthy wildlife and geographic features. 

Once we reached Mendenhall Glacier, they gave us a super-helpful safety briefing showing us how to properly walk on the ice. 

Our guides gave us plenty of time to savor walking onto the glacier as well as exploring an ice cave. We had much more time on the ice than on a helicopter tour.

All in all, it was a wonderful experience and we highly recommend it to anyone wanting to see a glacier up close.

The tour was incredible. Ben and Grant were wonderful guides, very well informed, pleasant and patient. We canoed to the glacier and walked out on it. The views were spectacular and one of a kind and we had hot drinks waiting for us after. I would definitely recommend this tour company, great value for the price.

name: West Glacier Trailhead
address: Skaters Cabin Rd, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Really fun hike. Be careful going off trail. Avoid scrambling up the side of the glacier when you get close. It gets pretty dangerous. As well as walking on melting ice. Amazing views and decent caves

Sign says it's maintained. Well it is up to a certain point then it becomes a 5.10 wall climb . Just kidding but It's not an easy hike if you want to make it all the way to the end of it.  About 40 minutes from the trail head you will have fantastic view of the glacier the mountains Mendenhall Lake and the valley . You might also see some beautiful vibrant colored blue birds. Just do it
AMAZING TRAIL. Take the outlook trail when the trail splits. Make sure you snap a picture of the map! It is a somewhat difficult hike. I would say not the best hike to do in the rain.
Great views! Great place! Must go here, total bucket list item. Walking on a glacier is surreal!!

A great moderate to strenuous hike especiallyduringthe winter months...lots of climbing walking, glasading on ice. There are 3 places that have a rope attached to a tree to assist with the hike.  Trails are maintained for about 3 miles...after that highly suggest downloading the url that is provided at one of the stops along the trail.  Remember to bring your ice tracks, gaiters and hiking poles...will make the hike easier.

name: Shrine of Saint Therese
reviews: AMAZING! This place is so humbling, centering, peaceful, and spiritual. If someone is struggling with a relationship with God, this is the place to find yourself and your relationship with God; surrounded by the beauty He created. The chapel is beautiful, the stations of the cross are simple, and the location is humbling and creates an environment to become one with your spirituality.
Parking lot number on is next to the cabins and church. It's a beautiful walk and just mesmerizing. I almost didn't make it due to schedule and I am so thankful that I did. Absolutely amazing.
So beautiful. So peaceful. You can really feel God's presence.
Beautiful,  serene...wonderful place to rejuvenate the mind and soul

Peaceful place off the beaten tourist path. Tribute to the patron saint of Alaska and Russia. The stone church overlooks a bay where whales can be spotted. We didn't see any during our time there but still worth the visit. Free parking. Donations are encouraged.

name: Steep Creek
address: Glacier Spur Rd, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews:
Steep Creek is an elevated walkway area where you can view bears in their natural habitat where both the humans and the bares can rest assured of not directly coming into contact.
Half the trail is closed during the weeks of the Salmon Run (Mid July - August).
For best chances of seeing a bear, go during the salmon runs, around 6am or after 7pm, when the cruise ship crowds die down.  Walk very quietly to not startle them away.

Wooden walkway adjacent to the parking lot for Mendenhall. Not to be overlooked or missed especially during Salmon season where you can see fish and bears. It's like you hiked quite a bit to get to a spot of respite when it's just beside your car. Plaques explain everything you need to know. Free.
To walk under the glacier is wonderful experience.  This glacier is the only one that is close to a city.
One of the best experiences in Alaska! It's nature at its best!
Got to see a couple of bears at sundown!

name: Cope Park
address: Cope Park Rd, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Great place with a playground and access to a stream. Good place to let small children off a cruise burn off some energy since it’s only a 10-15 minute walk from the port.
Wonderful sights, good for exercise.

Great place for my dog to play with other dogs. Easy to get to. Usually extra toys laying around and people are chill so the dogs are chill. Pretty area, up to date. Lots of parking. Neat  double fence system so you can get in with your dog and the other dogs don't run out. Or if your dog wants a second to sniff the other dogs before they all start mobbing the gate and playing around.
Incredibly beautiful park I. Downtown Juneau. play ground trails running River straight from the snow pack.
I love this park, however, seems like there's stalkers that like to hang out here. Caught one parked directly behind my car that sped away when they saw me walking back to my car.

name: Savikko Park
reviews: Fun! We had no idea this place was here. (We're fresh off the ferry!) Great little hike with fun finds.

Really nice kid and dog friendly beach, the waterline is very long and shallow so you can wade in and there's historical treadwell mine trails just a few feet into the forest. There's also the famous treadwell pumphouse that local artists and photographers have captured and displayed all over town.
WOW!  Lots of history on this beach and way scenic and windy. Take your camera, a warm coat, hat gloves and Dido too!  It's a doggies off leash paradise!

This was such a nice place to have an outdoor gathering after our wedding ceremony and reception.  We rented a shelter and had a fire and such a great time.  Unfortunately, you have to vacate the premises by 10PM, but we were able to move the fire to the beach and the festivities continued.
Know as sandy beach dog friendly and a great place for enjoying the summer day. Walk along the path and discover the old abandoned mine building's..

name: Alaska State Capitol
reviews: I had a awesome experience touring around the captial building.it is tourist friendly and filled with a lot of information.

Since the epicenter was very close, less than 10 miles away from my house, the ferocity of this earthquake was considerable, and severe enough to cause major infrastructure damage to local roads and bridges. You've probably seen a few of these pictures on the national news.
 
The event was quite scary, by far the biggest and most frightening earthquake I've ever experienced. The entire house rumbled and shook as if a freight train was running right through the living room. Being early morning on the last day of November, it was still dark outside, and the power went out almost immediately.
Great tour but did not see a SINGLE celeb. False advertising!
Interesting state capitol.
Free one hour tours offered by knowledgeable guide.  Compared to other Capitols, not as impressive, but nice. Cool photos and art in hallways.

name: Twin Lakes
reviews: Great place for the entire family to have fun and relax. It's also wonderful for handi•capable people to participate in activities. The big downside is that there isn't enough available parking.
Twin Lakes is a great place to take the kids. There are a lot of activities, such as swimming, playing frisbee, fishing, and the playground. It's a great get away from TV, and cell phones.
Excellent castle playground....my 6 year old son loves it...cool location...good paved pathways with plenty of room

There is plenty to do.. Fishing, boating, playground not just for kids but adults as well.. It has parking for the disabled, little paths around the lake to walk your pets, place to have a picnic with family or friends.. Restrooms & portable restrooms... It's a place to unwind.. Lay in the grassy Knowles.. Get a chance to check it out.. "GO FOR IT"!!!
Wonderful place.

name: Eagle Beach State Recreation Area
address: The Tongass National Forest, 28955 Glacier Hwy, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: With beautiful, untouched, vista views how could Eagle Beach not receive a 5 star rating? Picnic Areas, Trails, Beach-Front with  Sand and typically not crowded with traffic (people, vehicle, or otherwise). Great place to bird watch, look for animal tracks, simply sit and enjoy nature, or watch your kids play with sand/beach toys. Photo opportunities abound!
Spent the night out there with some of my friends, had a great time, even in the rain,  highly recommend if you get the chance
Berry Patch Cabin - nice open space, well maintained, beautiful views!
Rented a car. Coming off cruise ship. Beautiful scenery, muddy.
What a great place to stay! The cabins here are cheap, clean, and comfortable. Bring kerosene to power the stoves! Highly recommend.

name: Wickersham State Historic Site
reviews: Interesting old home of a key historical figure. Not a lot to see inside, but knowledgeable docent was very welcoming.
Fun historic house tour. Well worth the climb up the stairs.
The site keeper was excellent, so knowledgeable, personable & helpful! Loved the home & history!
Worth the walk. Don't miss this place!
Nice historical site

name: Chilkat State Park
reviews: Hike to Moose Meadows is easy, through forest to Rocky cove, round trip is 1.5 hours.
Nice park, great hosts and super clean bathrooms! The only thing I would say is an awful lot of people drive thru the campground (fast)! Beautiful place 😎

Best kept campground near Haines! Clean and well kept sites, clean bathrooms. Sites are mostly pull through with some back in. Road can be a bit rough but I had no problems at all with my 27' RV. Nice hikes and forested area nearby. Boat launch nearby and some good swimming if you don't mind some colder water. I was surprised but the water had very little salt from the ocean.  Campground hosts were friendly and welcoming...I am looking forward to returning next year!
Great hikes. Beautiful!
Love the scenery.  Beautiful place to visit.

name: Alaska Shore Excursions
reviews: What a wonderful time!! Great ATV's!! The rain forest is beautiful & it couldn't have been better weather!! It was so fun to meet so many nice people and to see the glacier.. then the extra special "Extras" that are in nature that we were blessed to see also... being able to see a whale in the water on our way back, all the sea lions & their babies, & the eagles!! Loved hearing all the historical & educational tidbits of the area, learning about the different types of rocks & stones in the area... it was an all over a great time!! Thank-you!! WE HIGHLY Recommend this Excursion!!

Top 5 experiences of my life. I cried out of joy seeing the beauty in the sky! This is a must do! We were met at the port, took an easy drive over, got suited up and instructions, flew to the glacier and had the most amazing experience with the dogs and the people at the camp.  The staff is amazing, friendly, and professional.  It was brilliant!

My photo says it all. In Juneau, Captain Sarah and Naturalist Katie put us on the humpbacks almost immediately. There was lots of spouting and we saw some tail fins. Within 15 minutes, we saw a humpback breach. That was followed up by a simultaneous breach by a mother humpback and her calf...then about six more breaches. By far, this has become my favorite vacation experience of all time. 

The Skagway mushing camp was also incredible. That staff was friendly and we got the most out of our day. I loved this excursion more than I expected.

Alaska Shore Excursions is reasonably priced and delivers on a first rate experience. I recommend this company to anyone visiting the ports they operate in.

Fantastic!!  We had so much fun and the helicopter/dog sledding ride on Herbert Glacier was definitely the best part of our trip.  We loved everyone at the Coastal Helicopters base as well as the Dog Sled Camp.  Names that come to mind are Owen (Gig 'em, Owen!) at Coastal Helicopters and James, our Musher at the Dog Camp.

We had a blast! My 38-year-old down syndrome niece  especially loved petting the dogs and the puppies.  Our shuttle driver was very informative even though he was feeling under the weather. The lady musher was good but  we would’ve loved to ride  much longer. Had fun  going over the bridge and listening to the History of the race.  It was wonderful that I booked two excursions with this company and they honor the $50 discount another company was going to give me. Thank you for a memorable experience.

name: JUNEAU FOOD TOURS
reviews: This is MUST. If you are stopping in Juneau put this tour at the top of your agenda. Amazing food, for an reasonable price. We stopped at many local locations to get samples of their top selling meals. Along the way the guide gave information about Juneau. We highly recommend this tour! Bring good shoes and layer up. Not too much walking but the weather is very unpredictable and you do spend some time outside!

While on excursion in Juneau, I went on the Juneau Food Tour with my family.   Charlie was our tour guide and it is truly a must do if you go to Juneau!   The tour shows a true array of the options in Juneau and Charlie was great explaining everything about Juneau.  Highly recommend this excursion to anyone!

name: White Pass & Yukon Route Railroad
reviews:
A Skagway must do! It’s expensive but worth it for 3 hours of beautiful scenery. The best views are outside standing against the railing. At some points you can almost touch the mountain! 
Before heading out, the person narrating the train ride will ask you to be courteous of others wanting to take pictures outside...just be prepared a bunch of people with cameras won’t listen and will literally stand in the same spot the whole time. Don’t be shy, ask them to let you through.

This Train ride is absolutely a must ride while visiting Alaska. The heights and views are magnificent.  If you dare brave go outside between the trains.  It's so exciting. Thank you for such a fabulous experience...

We opted to ride in the luxury car with unlimited food and drinks. There was no one under 21 years old allowed to ride in the car. It was worth the price paid. Breathtaking views with a tour guide to answer our questions. There was only seating for 14, so it was not crowded at all. The appetizer style food was delicious with a selection of beer, wine, and soda.

A great selection of gift items in the store at the stop in town.

The reviews here I am sure speak for themselves.  If I could stress one thing:

If you are on the fence about taking this tour as part of your cruise excursions, TAKE THIS EXCURSION.  

Myself and three buddies cruised through Alaska on Celebrity in May of 2019 and this excursion was easily everyone’s favorite and probably the highlight of the entire vacation.

The scenery is just as fantastic as you would expect.  The guides are great.  I have uploaded some of our pics from the day.

And if you are anything like me, you know there is nothing as awesome as a train.

We came on a beautiful day and really enjoyed the ride up and back. 

Pick the left side to get the best valley view on the way up (I think that it is a little longer time-wise since the train is slower going uphill) and side-of-the-mountain going down. You are not allowed to exit the train (there are no stops) or move from car-to-car once it starts moving. Our car was full, so no moving to other seats for us.

It is worth making it out to the outside platforms at least once. Our car had a platform hog who just stood there the entire trip and wouldn't share, but there is a platform on each end of the car. 

There are no food options, but bottled water is provided. Each car has one restroom, which nobody seems to know how to use--it takes 3 pumps to purge your poo, please. 

Informative guides makes announcements throughout the trip to point out sites of special interest. Recommended.

name: Icy Strait Point
reviews: We visited Icy Straight while on an Alaskan cruise. We had so much fun riding the zip line. On the bus ride up the mountain we saw a few bears. The bus driver was so nice to stop and let us take pictures. It was such a beautiful place and the views are amazing!

We stopped here as part of our Alaska cruise in May 2019. Our itinerary included the Ziprider and whale watching tour. Neither disappointed us. We had a great time. It is a 45 minute bus ride to the top of the mountain.  It only takes 60 seconds or so to get to the bottom. What a blast! The whale watching tour was great as well. Stop in the lodge and get a drink. I believe the one called "the zipper" comes with a  shot glass. The weather was perfect for us. I hope we can return again.
Tourist trap. Get to the next town over. There's some great restaurants and culture over there. And better tours. Local guides over there are rad.

Beautiful location! We went on the zip line here & LOVED it! Everyone was super nice. Only issue is there isn't much to do beyond shopping & the zip line. But the surrounding area is just gorgeous to sit & take in 😘
If you like to enjoy your own company like me then never miss a change to visit this place...

name: Mount Roberts Tramway
address: 490 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: This tramway was an ultimate with a spectacular view of mountains and beaches. As we head up or head down in tram, we can hear audio that tells us all about the view around. Heading up and then trek towards the tip of the hill in between enjoying the snow around is fun.

Short but fun tramway ride up the mountain. Price seemed a little steep, but I read reviews saying the views were incredible and absolutely worth it. Unfortunately, we rode it in the morning so the fog had not burned off yet. However, we still had an amazing few of the town up until about halfway; then, once we passed through the fog, we had an incredible view of the mountain range from above the fog-line. We still found it very worth the price; however, we wished we had known ahead of time that the ticket is good for all day. Had we known, we would have factored in more time in our afternoon to ride it again once the fog had cleared. Even so, I definitely recommend.

Simple walk-up ticket purchase at the terminal. Helpful and friendly staff. Ticket is good all day for unlimited trips. Facilities up top offer panoramic views from the terminal bridge and two additional city-facing observation points that are about a 5 minute hike up a trail with moderate grade. Well worth the small investment of effort. Additional trails are available for more commited hikers.  A basic restaurant with scenic views and a modest menu offers refreshment, as well as a small walk-up coffee bar serving fresh local brew.  Completely worth the $35 fare and easily one of the best activity experiences to enjoy within the town of Juneau.

This thing was cool. People complaining about $35 bucks for a once in a life time experience need to chill. Plus you get a discount for AAA. The views on top were phenomenal. I would do it again and be better prepared to hike all the way to the top!

Friendly and kind staff.  LOVED the opportunity to be able to see a live bald eagle up close and take pictures.  It's nice to know she is loved and taken care of.  The views are spectacular, but the food is expensive and just modified fast food, except for the crab.  Lovely walk through the woods on a well marked trail.  Great for all ages!  So many say it is too expensive but I don't agree.  They have to keep the tram serviced all winter when not operating and summer when up and running.  It is run on electricity.  If you plan right and take plenty of time to walk the trails, see the native film (only 20 minutes long) and truly appreciate the beauty of the mountain, it is money well spent.  There are native made gifts in the shop, some which you cannot find elsewhere.  A smart shopper will ask questions and know what you're buying.  We had a great time.

name: Red Dog Saloon
address: 278 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Awesome vibe. Excellent staff. Very inviting for the whole family (although we did eat early before any bar crowd). We got to write our name on the wall to commemorate our first visit and we'll see how many years we can go there to see it. Excellent food BTW.

What a cool spot in Juneau! Juneau has the pioneer charm that I would expect to find when visiting a place known as the last frontier. Visiting this saloon is the cherry on top of the whipped cream if you're looking for the pioneer nostalgia like I was. There are historical memorabilia hanging on the walls, flags on the roof rafters from visitors from all over the globe and writing on the walls from hundreds of patrons throughout the years. Bear skins, taxadermy moose heads, giant halibut and mountain goats are also decorating the walls. Oh, snap! I forgot to mention, the beer is cold and local, the food is delicious, and the service was great! Kristen was our bartender and brought a warmth that was missing from Juneau in the middle of January! Awesome job!

Quite an exciting place with old world charm.  Had a great piano player,  friendly people, and of course, in scenic Alaska.  My girlfriend was really impressed by the place.  Good thing Russia sold it to the US, or us Canadians would have a common border with Russia......can you even imagine that.....??
Good little piece of history in the midst of a politically corrupt town. But at least the beer is good, the atmosphere is comfortable and warm. And on rare occasions theres good scenery.
$10 for just 4 sad looking chicken strips form the freezer, it was $11.99 when I went there i'm ashamed, the best thing was the tap water

name: Above and Beyond Alaska (ABAK) Wilderness Adventures
reviews: I went on an ice climbing/hiking trip with Jacque and Jacob. They were both knowledge and very helpful. They have a clear passion for guiding and sharing the park and glacier.  I felt very safe even while ice climbing for the first time.  I'd highly recommend the glacier/ice climb trip for anyone looking for an adventure.

AMAZING experience with ABAK! My boyfriend and I did the Mendenhall Canoe Paddle and Glacier Trek with Jacques and Mike who were extremely knowledgeable, helpful and accommodating with our group. The views were simply incredible and the staff made it so much fun! 5 stars simply isn’t enough to rate this unforgettable experience! If you’re in decent enough shape to make this trek, don’t pass on this opportunity! I’d go back in a heartbeat!

Great cruise ship excursion experience. Bo and Ben did an amazing job showing our kids and ourselves the glacier in a safe, professional and fun way. If you're physically fit enough, I highly recommend this excursion.

Went canoeing and hiking up Mendenhall Glacier with two guides.  Hands down, this was the best thing I did while in Alaska.  The guides were very knowledgeable and clearly had a safety first attitude.  The paddle across the lake was easy since we had 13 people in a canoe working together to get us there.  The short hike to and trek on the glacier was amazing.  The glacier is gorgeous. We had time to get down into a small crevasse and check out the beautiful blue water at the bottom.  I hope to come back to Juneau one day and have a longer (half day) adventure on the glacier with the guides!

We did a private guided hike to the Mendenhall Glacier and it was the highlight of our trip. It’s the excursion we were most looking forward to and it by far exceeded our expectations. Our guide Daniel was amazing. The whole process what amazing. They were attentive to questions from the booking process to the actual event itself. The views are breathtaking and worth the challenging hike.  We enjoyed the challenge of the hike and along with the best workout, we got to see and walk on the beautiful glacier. The pictures don’t do it justice. Thanks Daniel for the highlight of our trip.

name: Bear Creek Outfitters
reviews: Great guide and amazing fishing. Even if I didn't catch anything (but I did) it was well worth every penny.

They canceled my trip after suiting up. Thank you for being safe and not putting us in a position where we couldn’t return safety or were at risk landing. I really hope to be back for a trip out with you.

Booked a trip two months before my trip to Alaska. Forty minutes before I was to meet my guide I got a phone call cancelling my trip. I should of gotten a call the night before so I would have time to try to make new plans. I called and spoke to the owner. All I got was BS excuses. I'm in the same business in Florida. I would never ever treat a customer the way I was treated. Find another company...
Great guides, good fishing and awesome fly  in float plane trip!
Had a fantastic fishing trip with these guys. Excellent friendly guiding service.

name: Juneau Tours
address: 76 Egan Dr STE 300, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: First of all, Juneau Tours went above & beyond in accommodating us on this tour! Our ship excursion was cancelled that morning & Juneau Tours managed to work us in very last minute. The office faculty so so very friendly & nice. Then we boarded the boat...! Boat was very clean & comfortable. Captain Kara, Danielle & Dave also so very friendly & fun! You could tell they had respect & passion for the whales. We felt as if we knew & understood the whales personally as Danielle shared her whale facts with us. Then of course, "Flame" the whale we saw that day, put on a spectacular show for us all! What an experience this was! This tour was truly one of our best! Made our whole trip! I WILL definitely use this agency again when visiting Juneau!

Excellent tour - I highly recommend this operator! The boat had a warm, comfortable cabin that offered very good viewing access. You could also view from outside the cabin and go up top where there were multiple areas from which to observe all the gorgeous scenery and of course whales!! We saw several whales and most of the sitings were close to our boat. Kudos to Capt. Dan for maneuvering close enough but not so close as to stress the whales. Our naturalists for the tour were Danielle and Sam - both were very enthusiastic, energetic and knowledgeable.  They were constantly checking with all of the guests to answer questions and help spot all of the wildlife! They were fabulous.  It was a very rainy day but they made it fun and completely worth the trip! The whole experience was well coordinated and required little effort on our part. Thank you!

We had the best time on this tour! They keep the groups small, so you’re not crowded together on one of those bigger boats. Chris, Amber and Jason did a fantastic job of finding the whales and teaching us several things about them. The boat is also well maintained and kept very clean. I would highly recommend booking with Juneau Whale Watch!

Dave Danielle and Brendan were so personal and the captain is a great whale whisperer. He got us amazingly close to a couple of whales. Great info on the way out and back to shore. Even got to see some cute sea lions!
Danielle, Maddie, and Captain Dan are passionate, knowledgeable, and responsible about wildlife.

name: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park Visitor Center
reviews: Loved the history! Both the place and all the info told by the historians  was a spine tingling adventure I added to my book of life. A chapter full of adventure.

The area of Skagway has several National Parks locations that are part of the one park.  Be sure to explore beyond the first building to get the full experience.  I suggest doing the junior ranger programs to learn the most about the park.

Excellent spot to visit and enjoy when you get a chance to check out Alaska. Knowing some things about the region helps you appreciate it just that much more. We've been twice and we're going back again soon. If you have the opportunity to visit... TAKE IT!

Friendly informative staff. Interesting things to read throughout.  Ladies bathroom had a lengthy line, smelled of urine and were tight corridors. There are four stalls though and in an emergency it served its purpose.
What a great place to learn about the area

name: Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve
reviews: Fantastic Glacier viewing here. Multiple glaciers to see also.  Mane seals and Bald Eagles too.     If Glacier Bay National Park is on your bucket list,  then be sure to see it. You won't be disappointed.

A bucket list experience for sure. Absolutely a must see before they disappear, which is a sad reality. One of the most breathtaking experiences is to hear the Glaciers crackle and shift. Truly something everyone should experience

The beautiful place to go around & see big glacier melting down to the sea,see the big blue ice in this place.many ice small group of ice burg fotting around and flotting around the sea.
The beautiful weather with chilling air makes you to feel the beauty of mother earth.you will just love this place of sea, water,air , glaciers, mountain.
Just one of the most most most beautiful place to see of life time moment
Visited here during a cruise, an absolutely stunning location with such fresh air to breathe, if you haven't visited it's a must without a doubt one of the must stunning places I have ever witnessed!

Alaska was not my first choice for vacation,   only because when I vacation I like warm and sunny. But I must say I had a wonderful time. The beauty was breathtaking! Glacier Bay was my favorite,  you can not miss this opportunity if you are visiting!

name: Tracy’s King Crab Shack
address: 432 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Absolutely a must try! It's worth every bite! Although it is delicious, it's very filling! One King Crab leg was too much for just me, but I powered through! The service was great and it was interesting being able to see them cooking the food outside.

Highly visible landmark eating establishment within sight of the ship. This restuarant remains Ed busy as Alaskan tourists expect great seafood dishes. They were not disappointed by either quality nor quantity. It's an amazingly fun place.
The staff can handle the business in an efficient friendly manner. As with all things Alaskan, this is visual dining. Highly recommend Tracy's King Crab Shack.

Went for a really amazing concert/dance, Collette Costa band incredible performers, super fun. Tons of people. Staff was really nice, thoroughly enjoyed myself. Also been there for their food which is out of this world!
HUGE! The crabs are HUGE! You gotta get to Tracy's when you go to Juneau! Bling Blinky of TEXAS Shout Out: Cracking Good Crab Legs!!

Awesome place. Visited with my family during our cruise to Alaska. Crab cakes were so good, we ended up ordering few extra orders to take back on the ship with us. 
The best chowder I have ever had, will definitely be back for more next time we visit Juneau.

name: DIPAC Macaulay Salmon Hatchery
reviews: Serene, nice quiet location. Good to have a walk, enjoy a few drinks and the fresh seafood and learn about the history.
Very nice stop on our excursion. We learned a lot about salmon life. Very interesting.  We saw many bald eagles in the area as well.
This is a fun, quick stop to see the salmon. It's worth the time. There is a paid tour, but you can see tons of fish just along the shore. Have fun!

AWESOME!!  so exciting to see all the King Salmon coming back "home" (we are here in September)   It really is a great place to learn about Salmon .. WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND!  and seals were cute too .. albeit they were having a snack😮
Amazing place to visit!! Could watch the salmon all day.

name: Gastineau Guiding Company
reviews: Great tour. We got to see a bunch of whales and even some killer whales on our boat ride. The glacier trail are very easy and nice. Dirk and Lisa are very knowledgeable making the your fun and educational.

We did the photo Safari tour - a combination of a short first walk to see the glacier, and a whale watching tour. 
Our guide, Mark, was great - informative and funny. And our whale watching tour with Captain Kelly was a great success with many humpbacks really close up (they kept coming towards us!).

This tour exceeded all of our expectations. Our tour guide was Britney, and she was fantastic - funny, knowledgeable, entertaining and informative. Our Captain was Captain Mac - and he was also fantastic and really knew where and how to find the whales and how to get the best photographs of them. He consistently positioned the boat to afford us the best lighting and backgrounds to photograph whales. Plus, he knew the local whales well, where to find them, and which ones would likely be the most active and interesting to watch and photograph.

We came to Alaska to see whales, and this tour delivers! They guarantee you will see whales on their tour, and we saw MANY, including a mother and calf. This was an educational, exciting, comfortable and thoroughly enjoyable experience. We cannot thank them enough to recommend them highly enough!

I am including some photos with this review taken from my husband's iPhone. In other words, these are not even the good photos that we took on our DSLR. You will get fantastic opportunities for pictures on this tour. Don't hesitate - JUST GO!

My wife and I had an absolutely wonderful time as Shannon, Adam K., & Captain Fred lead us through whale watching and a small bit of hiking. They were all very knowledgeable and taught us so much, we had an excellent time. I would highly recommend doing a tour with them!

Wow!!!  I'm completely hooked on whales and studying them now.  The things we learned on the boat and what we saw just can't be duplicated on one of those bigger boats.  Personal service- she took the time to get to know is and at least our names.  I got to pull in and throw out a crab pod. Lol. It was tiny but still!!!  I felt such a connection with the whales.  Not completely sure I would have on a bigger vessel. We saw a sea otter the guide had only seen twice the previous year. Her personal stories were great and tired everything together.  

You will NOT regret booking a tour with this company.

We loved Captain Todd and Richelle, our guide.  Thanks, y'all!  
7/11/19

name: Alaska 360
reviews: We loved the tour and Goldie was fanominal.  One of the best days of or cruise.  The food was excellent and the the best was the root beer float to top it all off.
What a great place to learn about dog sledding. Everyone was very knowledgeable about the sport of dog sledding. A great hands on experience for young and old!
Not as advertised! BS staged/fake panning, and didn't tour anything real. The sled dogs were cool, of course, but a be ititarod chamber... Only 2 stars because the puppies and sled dogs!
Small place but very interesting. People are dressed nicely in period costume. We tried the gold panning, the assayer office is so beautifully done.
Interesting place, but is kissing the final touch, food is great, highly suggested the ribs. Perfect for families.

name: Amalga Distillery
address: 134 N Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: I am not a gin drinker and enjoyed this place. However, as a non gin drinker my other half did have to finish my beverage. He however really liked this gin. The bar was a little hot inside though and and could use some fans or something so there is air circulation.

There is so much to love about Amalga Distillery, from their wonderful drinks to their kind staff to the way they foster community within our little town. In particular, my loved ones and I enjoy stopping into Amalga for Blood Mary Sundays. I love that they incorporate local and foraged ingredients in their beverages. Furthermore, the events they hold on site (like Maker's Markets or artist nights) provide opportunities for local creatives to connect with the community. Amalga makes our city so much cooler and tight knit, and I'm so glad they're here!
Quirky little 2 drink limit bar that's  legally a tasting distillery. Nice gin cocktails.  Popular with locals. Gets noisy. Closes early.

This new distillery is amazing. If you like Gin, then you have to go here. Design is unique, great vibes and friendly staff. They have a variety of different drinks to go with their different flavors of Gin.

This place was awesome! It was just drinks and you could do a tasting. There was a lot of room to hang out then end tables facing the street. We just happened upon it and would’ve spent a lot more time here. I would highly recommend it if you’re here in town

name: The Rookery Cafe
reviews:
Nice spot in town. Came on a whim off of the cruise ship. Food comes out in a timely manner and is pretty tasty. Good portion of avocado with the eggs benedict, too!! The potatoes that came with the dish we're perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

If I come back, I'll be sure to try their baked goods.
Delicious and great portion size. Loved the ambience and staff were so friendly. Highly recommend.

Great coffee and breakfast with a funky, friendly vibe. Counter service, but food delivered to your table. Crowded and buzzy, mostly locals. They have a nice selection of pastries, along with cooked breakfasts - try the smoked salmon benedict.
I go there every morning for my coffee.  Love the cool vibe and friendly people.  Always see someone I know.  A great place to start the day.

Cute little cafe, my mocha was delicious! I ordered the eggs Benedict, they were good but not the best I’ve ever had. The hollandaise sauce was a little different and it was kinda cold when I got it. Big portions, though.

name: Glacier Muffler-Mechanical Inc
address: 2450 Industrial Blvd UNIT A, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Great service and great people to work with! Hard to find no nonsense straight shooters like these guys.
Great mechanics. Family like, honest.
They do what they can to get your car fixed

My neighbor recommended this place to us. I'm very happy he did, not only did they get me in quickly, they were professional, courteous and got it fixed fast. They actually recommended NOT needing more done right now because other things were sound. Who does that??? Super fair price! We will take ALL our vehicles here and recommend to others!

We have a fleet of 8 commercial high use vehicles that Terry and the team have helped us maintain for over a decade and we couldn't recommend them highly enough. Honest, straight forward, and never nickle and dimes. Stuff goes wrong, but we trust them to always be realistic and provide us all the options to have top notch safe vehicles on the road. Thank you Glacier Muffler Team!

name: Sitka National Historical Park
reviews: Lovely walk through woods. The totem poles are fascinating and beautiful. We were there at the beginning of August so saw salmon going upstream and spawning.
Absolutely beautiful! It was so green and quiet.  We spent hours walking around the woods and along the paths. Definitely a must see!
Just amazing. We were there during the salmon run. The totem poles were great and the trail walk was superb.
I'm posting this review over a year after visiting and I still can vividly remember this place. Can't wait to go back

Very cool place!  We were lucky in choosing the right tour which included this stop, but to be fair our guide really made it come alive.  However, the abundance of plant and forest was mind blowing.  The trails were in fantastic shape.  Easy to walk.  Wide enough to accommodate at least 4 adults shoulder to shoulder.  Several benches placed frequently throughout the trails we were on which helped those of us who needed a break every so often.  The totems were in good shape as well which gave us gawkers even more to appreciate.

name: Alaska Raptor Center
reviews: It was amazing to get up close to all the eagles and owls. We learned so much about them and their rehabilitation process. We found this place almost by accident and are extremely glad we went.

Great place but sadly only had 30 minutes on my guided tour so we didn't get to see much I would suggest at least hour minimum. Staff was eager to share their knowledge. Spirit the Bald Eagle was very impressive .

A must see.  Sure, you've seen raptors at zoo's, but this place is different.  You feel their mission to rescue some of God's creatures.  The guide was knowledgeable and friendly.  He took the time to educate as well as showing appreciation for our desire to learn more.

Very cool place, focus on education for patrons, and saving amazing aviary creatures for rerelease if possible! Give yourself some extra time here, there is tons to see and learn. I even picked a Salmon Berry to try!
Love that they are rehabbing these bald eagles and others! Have  beautiful walking trails. We also saw wild bald eagles in this area. We found it all very interesting!!

name: Eldred Rock Lighthouse
reviews: A cool lighthouse to pass by on the ship! It was constructed in 1905 and turned automated in 1973. This is the oldest remaining lighthouse in Alaska.
Passed through on a cruise ship right at sunset in a late August date to capture this beautiful picture.
Davidson Glacier, in the background, is no longer visible from this location. This photo is from 1982.

name: Cathedral of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary
reviews: Beautiful small special cathedral. Peaceful and prayerful.
A very beautiful cathedral...

Praise God.
After 11AM mass there was a mini lunch.
Pleasant church. Great staff. I really connected to this place. Welcoming and friendly.
Great church family.

name: Frenchie's Floral Studio
reviews: I love Frenchie’s Floral! Last year on Mother’s Day I received the most exquisite flower arrangement of my entire life! Their creations are unique and artful. I purchase my succulents there as well. They offer single plants and little groupings that look amazing year round. I am able to incorporate their curated vessels for both flowers and plants into my own decor. The gorgeous, boutique style store is fun to visit- it always lifts my spirits!

I have used Frenchie's Floral Studio personally, and for my business for several years. I love this business! They offer a variety of services, including floral arrangement deliveries which is amazing for my busy schedule. I also love that they have a variety of prices available on floral arrangements- so I can always find something that fits my budget (whether it is a small gift bouquet or a show-stopping center piece).  You can call ahead and place an order OR just walk in! The staff is always super helpful and responsive and the arrangements are truly works of art.  I love working with Frenchies.

I was so pleased to do business with Frenchie's Floral Studio! The customer service representative on the phone was so helpful and cheerful. I saw pictures of the bouquet  they sent to my sister in Juneau, AK and it was more beautiful than I could have ever imagined! Frenchie's not only made my sister’s day, but  they made mine- all the way from Virginia! Thank you so much!

Melissa is an energetic breath of fresh air. 
She was very helpful in making my selection.  
The arrangement was delivered on the requested day and I received an email giving confirmation.   The recipient sent me a photo of an absolutely beautiful  floral arrangement.  She was delighted! 
Well done Frenchie's Floral Studio!!!

I picked up flowers for Valentine's day. The store was lovely and I was very impressed when I learned that the store uses local floral sources. I also love that the store encourages people to reuse vases rather than buying new ones. Excellent customer service and assisted me in a timely manner. It was overall a very friendly environment. I loved that they mixed and matched flowers and customized my bouquet. It came out truly beautiful and unique.

name: Unplugged Adventure
address: 549 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: This is by far the best way to see Juneau! The guys who run the place were extremely helpful.  The jeeps are all brand new and are beautiful. Jeeps come with an iPad with built-in GPS and a electronic tour guide to explain all the sites. We were able to see nearly every main “site” Juneau has to offer. Keep up the great work unplugged adventure!
Great overall experience. Would do it again without hesitation.

I highly recommend renting a Jeep from Unplugged Adventures. If you like designing your own adventure without buses and crowds, you will love seeing Juneau by Jeep. Given the cost of a bus ticket or a cruise excursion,  it is very cost effective as well. There's even an iPad with a pre-installed narrated tour. It was one of the many highlights of our Alaskan adventure. Thanks for helping us make amazing memories! Here's just a few of the sight seen from our little red Jeep ...

100% this is a must do when visiting Juneau! The staff was super friendly,  and accommodating. Pricing was not bad. Jeep was clean and ready to roll. GPS navigation was spot on. An amazing experience overall. Would totally do again!
What a wonderful way to explore Juneau. Freestyle, laid back and on your own. So happy we stumbled on to this. Thanks for making this stop unforgettable!

name: Gold Creek Salmon Bake
address: 1061 Salmon Creek Ln, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: A terrific experience! Outdoor venue with plenty of seating - grilling salmon and a buffet of all you can eat on top of that!  Great for families! Walk way back in the woods to the waterfalls and see the old mining equipment from the Gold Rush Days! Be sure to get a great souvenir - a t-shirt or magnet! Bling Blinky of TEXAS Shout Out: I am sitting here in Texas wishing I had a bite of that flamed grilled salmon! DELICIOUS!! Gotta get back to Gold Creek and EAT!! LOVED IT

The salmon was very tasty, but the sweet sauce they put over it was amazing. The area is protected and quaint. As you eat, you sit in protected tents, enjoying the outdoors but staying dry. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this salmon bake.

Great way to see life style and nature with the experience of eating outdoors with the beauty of nature around you and the cutural food of the region. I was there when it was warm and not in winter. From Louisiana, enjoyed the beauty of the land, sampling foods of another culture and appreciating the ways of life in different parts of our world.
The salmon was amazing! We went here as part of an excursion and it was a really cool place.
This was a fun excursion and a chance to eat fresh salmon.

name: Fortress of the Bear
address: 4639 Sawmill Creek Rd, Sitka, AK 99835, USA
reviews: Great educational facility and tourist attraction. The bears live good lives here that they would never have gotten to lead otherwise. Natural habitat, feeding and wellbeing is at the heart of what these guys do. I hope this place continues to flourish and develop over the next few years.

Great place to visit! Great education spot about bears. The bears seem happy and healthy. A new visitors center is being constructed and will certainly enhance viewing and learning opportunities. Plan on spending 30 to 60 minutes.

They are currently working on updating and expanding the visitors center. But the staff was very informative and friendly. The bears where all out and in view they seemed happy. A pair even frolicked for us. Great visit

Amazing! I could spend all day there watching the bears and learning more. Chris was great offering to educational tidbits and information on volunteering. I'm hoping to be back next summer to volunteer here.

Go to the zoo. Save your money. They don't rehabilitate bears but rather rescue them and raise them as pets. Come pay to see my dogs. You will help me raise them and get more out of it. Know what I mean?

name: Chilkat Bald Eagle Preserve
reviews: Took the float river trip through here in September. Saw tons of bald eagles. Really pretty area and a great excursion.
If you love eagles you will love this place.
Amazing opportunity to see these beautiful creatures like never before
Fun and safe adventure with access to view many bald eagles and get some great photos. Guides were knowledgeable. Food and drinks were average.
Wonderful place to go and beautiful landscape with all sorts of wildlife

name: Sealaska Heritage Institute
address: 105 S Seward St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: The people are lovely to talk to and so proud. Beautiful gifts, jewelry and books. They have a great walk through museum.
Cute place to visit, small but very informative
Very interesting, and interactive screens to play with. Learned a lot.
Incredible place, beautiful art work and souvenirs for sale, all Alaskan made
Beautiful local carvings and artwork.  Knowledgeable docents.

name: The Local Guy Charters & Sightseeing
reviews: Adam and his crew are great!  Very low-key but serious about getting us to good fishing spots.  Highly recommend them!  We had a great day fishing, then they helped us drop off our fish for processing to be shipped back to TN.  Best boat charter experience ever.

Incredibly fantastic trip!  Captain Adam rocks it! We left at 8:00 and by 10:00 had caught our Halibut limit and both were extremely nice sized. We then headed to salmon waters where we had just as much fun catching salmon. We opted to head back in with enough time to catch some quality whale watching which turned out to be spectacular! Local Guy Charter works hard and strives to tailor the trip to your desires. This was our anniversary and Captain Adam made it special. He knows his fishing areas, and works hard to make sure you land em. Most highly recommend this outfit. When we come back, it’s Local Guy Charter for us. Thank you Captain Adam!

What an awesome trip!!  We caught our limit and when we returned to our cruise ship, we discovered that those who had taken the fishing charters that were offered on the ship, caught nothing!!  The ship would have charged us 4 times more and we would have experienced less!! Captain Adam and his deck hands (Samantha and Marcus) were wonderful with our autistic son and made sure that he had an amazing trip.  He took the time to visit seals, feed bald eagles, and learn about glaciers. As an educator myself, I know that Adam is the perfect teacher with his knowledge and enthusiasm.  I give him an A+!  I am also an amateur photographer and Adam took us places to get stunning photos! The afternoon on the Legacy was the highlight of our entire cruise!

Adam is amazing!  We found him online and loved our day with him so much that we canceled the tour we had scheduled for the next day and went out with him again.  He is easy to talk to and is very knowledgable about the history of the area.  I have highly recommended his charter to all my friends who are traveling to that area.  You won't really experience this beautiful area until you book with him!!

IF YOU ARE LOOKING TO GET RIPPED OFF, TAKEN ADVANTAGE OF, and SWINDLED this is NOT the company for you. If you are looking for a knowledgeable guide who can put you on the fish, a captain who understands the time constraints dictated by cruise lines, AND the ability to get you back to ship in the unlikely event of boat trouble, Captain Adam is the guy of your wildest dreams and fantasies. Captain Adam and Deckhand Chris gave our group of 4 the best fishing trip imaginable. Not only did everyone catch multiple fish, but we saw orca whales, glaciers, and a sea otter. When we return to Juneau, this is our “go-to” guy!

name: Zerelda's Bistro
reviews: Amazing food!!!! Love it love it love it. Wish i could go more its pricey. Great customer service. Amazing pastries. Wish they had more vegetarian options.

Must, absolutely MUST stop for lunch or supper. We probably bombarded them with a party of 11 people and it didn't even phase them. If it did no one would have noticed by the out going and upbeat attitude of the staff. I got a cheddar burger and it was by far the best I have ever had....that is saying a lot!  Keep up with what you are doing because it works.

Very loud place. If that doesn't bother you, perfect! If it does, you may not like dining here. It's also tiny, tables are cramped, seating (naturally, since its a small place) is strange as you seat yourself but there aren't enough tables usually, and you may end up sitting at the end of a table with random people you don't know just to snag a seat, and it was just uncomfortable for me.  The food was good, so that was the redeeming quality despite all the discomfort. I still don't think I'll eat here that often though. If they ever move to a bigger spot I'll reconsider.
Delicious food in a great environment! A comfortable friendly place, with a good value, yummy selection of food (including incredible pastries!)
Great selection of wholesome food. Best Burger I've had in a long time.

name: V's Cellar Door
reviews: I haven’t even paid the bill yet but it’s so good I had let people know! This is hands down the best restaurant I’ve eaten while visiting Juneau! The food was reasonably price and service was awesome. Go, eat and enjoy.
I wasn’t sure what to expect, but was very impressed with the food.  We had the fusion burrito with seared ahi and the taco sampler.  Great combination of flavors.  Would highly recommend.
The food was so good that I came back several times during my trip. Everybody is friendly and the cozy urban vibe is very welcoming. Unique - but tasty - food that you won't find anywhere else.
This place has food that was amazing. Everything I tried was delicious. Service was excellent.
Always feel like family when here! Food is great, and they are willing to help you find the dish that fits your taste! Even the salads are delicious.

name: Deckhand Dave's Fish Tacos
address: 139 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Great fish tacos! And I’m from fish taco Capital - San Diego! This is a food truck. Can’t decide? Get the combo of battered halibut, blackened rockfish, & battered sockeye salmon. Yum! Also had the   halibut fish cake for appetizer. Goes great w the nearby Alaskan lager. Outdoors food court, communal seating.
Everything was delicious. Magical tacos, great service, great beer. Don't stop anywhere else, go straight here!!! Were from florida and can safely say best fish tacos anywhere!
Trash bear was fantastic! Blackened cod over tasty fries covered in spicy sauce with cilantro... Yum

Delicious fish tacos! Get the sampler if you're not sure which type of fish taco to indulge. Good local craft beer selection, friendly service. Dog friendly since all of the seating is outdoors. Tourists and locals love this place alike.

Tacos were good! We are from California and fish tacos are normally fairly large for one serving and these ones were, from our perspective, rather small servings for the price we paid. That being said, though, the quality was good and very fresh fish. They have seats in the open and under cover. This was nice since it was especially hot while we were there!! Location is good and next to a lot of other food truck/tent type places right next to the cruise ships docks.

name: Seong's Sushi Bar
reviews: This has been a fairly regular stop for me now that I work downtown. Never have been disappointed.

Best Mongolian beef I've ever had.
Sushi is best in town, hands down.

My to go box was basically all white rice. So lame and super expensive. This happens all the time, all the Asian restaurants pile on the white rice, but skimp on the main dish. $14.95 for white rice, should have gone to Costco and bought my own bag.

Its not a bad place to eat compared to the other asian orientated restaurants in Juneau. HOWEVER, you MUST be VERY SPECIFIC with your orders due to the fact there are many of the same recipes with different names, ESPECIALLY with the sushi menu AND Lunch "specials" where YOU MUST SAY its for lunch special you want, otherwise you'll be charged the more expensive version of the meals. They do wonders with their quality meat and amazing combination of flavors that don't ruin the rest the meal and they DO serve plenty of meat in the meals... if you decide on the SPECIFIC meal that has it.
