Most the time the 'different' meals are based on how much ingredients they add and just on how you pronounce the name (in english or in its native tongue) which will end up with a 20 dollar difference in paying per patron. Which if it comes to delivery, Little Tokyo with Asiana Gardens as back up, take out Seongs for the on the go local here in Juneau. LASTLY, THEY DO NOT DELIVER AND THEY WILL ONLY REMEMBER YOU IF YOU SKIP OUT ON A PICK UP and not a month straight up picking up the same 7 dollar meal with 5 dollar soda charged AND a 5 dollar tip. Good food, expedient service, first 5 minutes is friendly. Most you can ask for in a Tourism town based restaurant.
Best sushi in town!! Pricey but very good

name: McGivney's Sports Bar & Grill Downtown
reviews: Great breakfast,  very nice atmosphere,  we ate there breakfast and some din er great pasta dish and pancakes. Much better food that sandpiper cafe.
My daughter go here a couple times a year for some Mother/Daughter time and every time the food is amazing, our server is fantastic, and our food comes out very quickly!

I'd give this place 3.5 stars if I could, so I rounded up to be fair.  I typically get wings when I eat here with friends from work. It's not my type of restaurant, but it has a good social atmosphere. I feel like the menu is a bit lackluster, but also I LOVE their pretzel sticks with beer cheese appetizer. If you want bar food, this is the place to go. As an aside, my 12-year-old loves their pizza.
Solid bar food downtown. Good chicken fried steak for breakfast and doing well with their fish and chips too. Watchout Hangar
Came here as part of Princess Cruise Juneau Food Tour. Had a nice piece of a pork shank that was very good.

name: TK Maguire's
reviews: I have eaten at this establishment on a few occasions. Their buffet brunch is amazing and you leave just absolutely stuffed of a huge variety of food. They have a separate dinning room where people can rent it for parties. I had my work party there and it was amazing service. Susan was a great bartender. Highly reccomend them for any occasion.

We ordered the Tex mex & Golden Pan skillets(pictured) , big portions like dinner size portions. We Probably should have shared one, everything was hot and the coffee was good. Server was chill I'd recommend this place.

I recently had the Mexican buffet  and was very disappointed.  The rice was crunchy, the beans were unrecognizable, there were no chopped lettuce onions, tomatoes to garnish.  No salsa or chips or cheese. Just sour cream, sliced tomatoes and some green stuff in a bowl.  the other food items were also unidentifiable.  I recognized the chicken thighs and ate that.  If you set out a buffet you have to make sure the items are attended to.  Add salsa to the rice to keep it moist, put signs out to tell what each item is and have garnishes available.  Very disappointed.  Your regular menu is good. but the buffets are not.  Even the breakfast buffet was a let down when it was available.
Food was really good. Our server Susan was very friendly and helped us with finding our way about town. Will definitely be back next time in Alaska.

I've been coming here for their Sunday Brunch buffet off and on for a while.  I've noticed that they're ratching down on the quality of what they serve, staff turnover.  The last visit, they dialed down on their dessert offerings with danish and chocolates instead of more pies and cakes.

On the month of your birthday, they'll offer you a meal up to $25, but check.

name: gonZo CULT AK
reviews:
Going to breakfast at Gonzo with my partner is one of my favorite Sunday morning rituals. Their baristas are talented and the food is out of this world. I love what Aims, the owner, has done to offer Juneau with unique, flavorful waffle combinations. There are also a slew of vegetarian and vegan options on the menu, a rarity in this little town. 

Don't mind what others have said about poor customer service. The staff has always been helpful and kind, and though this is one of the many places in town where you have to grab your own water and bus your own table, the prices on the menu reflect that so that you never feel like you're paying for sit-down service. Keep on keeping on, Gonzo friends!
My favorite dish is the Carnivores Unite. Sausage and bacon cooked into the waffle with homemade gravy to top it off. I tell everyone they have to try this place when they’re in Juneau.
This is my favorite place to go to for breakfast. The atmosphere is great, art music...much like my own home :) The food is great too. The biscuits are amazing.
Best breakfast during my trip to Juneau! Got the Cat’s Meow AND Spam Mail 🤤🤤
It is located close to the airport. I asked the rental car agent for a good breakfast restaurant and she told us about this place. It is nice cozy place, food looks pretty, tastes ok.

name: The Salmon Spot
reviews:
It really is just a spot! In a place smaller than a container but barely bigger than a Ford F250 these girls whip up a limited set of ground salmon dishes from fish that were likely in the ocean just the day before.

While super fresh an oh so tasty, I would have asked for my salmon burger without the cheese - my taste buds prefer their fish without cheese, hence my virgin tuna melts sans cheddar...
The baby salmon cakes are highly recommended, the burger fantastic (grab a heap of napkins from the stash under the umbrellas, you'll thank me later), the chowder ok, skip the make-it-yourself soft serve as twirling the perfect scoop is a lot harder than it looks and the ice cream softer than you want it - lick fast.

Delicious, simple and easy!  There is a reason why the line stretched down the block but was well worth the wait.  

If only they could add some more seating on the patio!

This place is wonderful. Great prices, excellent product. We tried one of everything. Everything was very good. The salmon burger was very flavorful and tender. The salmon patties are the perfect size and come with an amazing sauce, and the chowder tastes great and is probably perfect for a chilly day. The owners are friendly and local. I highly recommend the burger!
Salmon cake was super delicious. Highly recommend!
There salmon burgers are very good. And, for Juneau, it is pretty reasonably priced.

name: Donna's Restaurant
reviews: I've only ever had items from their breakfast menu, but they were all fantastic. The meals themselves are fairly reasonably priced ($9), although a piece of pie is, like, 6 bucks!  In any case, they're definitely worth checking out.

I stopped here before my helicopter glacier tour for a quick bite and was so pleasantly surprised. I wasn’t expecting much, as I was in for a quick bite, but I ordered “donnas special” and was in for a real treat. The rain deer sausage is LIFE! Definitely stop by if you are visiting town 🙌🏻🙌🏻

You want quality service, friendly smile, someone to make you feel like your family... Well let Donna's staff and customer service make you feel that way...! From biscuits and gravy to French dip sandwiches... Top it off with the best milkshakes in all of juneau... We love it.. At least once a week we make it our priority to gather the whole family and head down there to eat there homemade pies with a scoop of ice cream.. The dinner menu is phenomenal.. The way the meals are served it's just excellent.. If you want good home cooking bring the whole family to enjoy the moment... You will not be disappointed...

Ate here this morning. In town celebrating my birthday. Hands down the best steak and eggs breakfast I've ever had. Couldn't eat it all but I tried! Lol. Food was great, service was great. Not far from my airbnb and on the bus line. I'm going back to try the pancakes before I leave town.
Good food and really good desserts. Pretty fair prices, especially for the desserts and how much they give you. Would definitely recommend this as a place to go and eat.

name: The Wild Alaskan
reviews: Halibut sliders & Fries. Amazing!

I thought the halibut tacos were delicious. I recommend them. The service was very good, and the workstation for preparing the food was very clean. That means a lot to me. I will be a return customer. Very satisfied.
Great food and friendly owner - you can't go wrong getting a meal here!

The Wild Alaskan is as wild as it gets! MUST stop in Juneau alongside the Alaskan Brewing Company. He was excited as we ordered our food and that excitement transfered over to the food. Amazing burgers and halibut like nowhere else. It's not a trip to Juneau without visiting The Wild Alaskan.
Got the halibut sliders and fries but the pieces on the sliders were so small and thin  I could barely taste the fish. More bread than fish for $14

name: McGivney's Sports Bar & Grill
address: 9105 Mendenhall Mall Rd, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews:
Decent burgers, service can be slow. 
Range of appetizers. 
I've been here several times the food is good not excellent but good.
Service is often slow so, if your in a hurry this is not the place.
Casual atmosphere, good food, variety of drinks. Pricing a basic burger and fries is 15. A monster double decker is 27$
Amazing customer service, nice atmosphere, beautiful women and amazing drinks. Just stay away from the steak.....
This place was amazing!  Hubby Ordered the Everything Burger - the meat was super fresh and the bacon was as to die for. I got the Shepard’s Pie and it tasted very homemade. Will definitely go back.
Great atmosphere delish steak sandwich and bisque. Amazing service and I highly recommend it to everyone.

McGivney's in the valley is better in some ways than the one downtown.  I like the atmosphere at this location better.  The kitchen closes 22:00 so it's not a late night place for food.  The Sandbar serves food late night.  The food and service is decent.  Karaoke on Thursdays starting at 21:00.  Weekday happy hours 15:00-17:00 for a ten percent discount on appetizers.  Sometimes their food has too much pepper like their meatball soup.

name: The Island Pub
reviews: Some of the best pizza I've ever had.  I've have only have a few items off their menu but they were all absolutely delicious.  Island Pub has a lively and high energy atmosphere.  It's a bit pricey and it does take them a while to bring you your food but it's worth the wait!  Recommended

I really enjoyed the Island Pub. The Salmon dip was good and I thoroughly enjoyed the pizza. That grilled flavor in the pizza was amazing. Also, some interesting toppings are available for you to customize your pizza or try something new.

If you're looking for a spectacular night out then this is the place. The food is always amazing and so fresh. This is where you want to go for one of a kind pizza (not to mention make-it-your-own). The bar is always busy and has a great drinking menu. Add in there an amazing view and you'll want to stay all night long. If you're looking for something lighter then head to the appetizer menu!

This absolutely has to be one of the best places in Juneau. It is a gem off the beaten path and surrounded by many trails, beaches and various things to do while on Douglas Island. The staff were phenomenal; attentive, friendly, courteous, kind, cheerful and a real pleasure to be around. The restaurant itself was beautiful inside and out, very pleasing astetically, and immaculately maintained. And now for the food. Everything on the menu looked amazing but it was unfortunate the inability to try it all. The wings were fantastic and the steak sandwich was.as.well. Their pizzas and toppings had me wishing I could somehow make more room. I will definitely be hanging out there with every visit to Juneau!!!

One of the best restaurants in Juneau if not the best. They rotate their beers on tap and always have something different. Pizzas #1 on the menu but everything is rather tasty. I’d recommend the salmon spread as appetizer and Perniola pizza (spelling?). Good service nice atmosphere good people. The newer Mikes Place for all you older Juneau locals

name: Pel'meni
reviews: I stop by here almost every time I am in Juneau. Very small place with hip feel and the best pelmeni I had anywhere including during my trip to Russia. Open late night after midnight is obviously huge plus.
2am food or an afternoon snack. Pel meni is delicious at any time of day. 🌙

what an interesting vibe, this place. They have a wall full of records and are always playing oldies. The food was really good. I never really experienced Russian dumplings, but that was really really good.

Place is loud. If that doesn't bother you, perfect! If it does, you might not like dining in here. It's also small and not suited for large crowds of people. The food is decent and doesn't cost a lot of $$$.
Delicious dumplings! Only two things on the menu: potato or meat, makes it easy to order.  Make sure to add some of the house hot sauce.

name: In Bocca al Lupo
reviews: Lupo is my go-to restaurant for date nights with my fiance, girls nights with my friends, and for special dinners with loved ones visiting from out of town. The menu is a combination of super flavorful dishes that meld innovation with tradition. If I can, I try to order from the specials menu, as these are usually a nod to the most seasonal ingredients and creative dishes. I'm grateful that the Lupo team creates incredible food while also keeping the atmosphere of the restaurant relaxed and down to earth. Thanks for keeping us full and well fed, friends!

A must see when in Juneau. Hey cruise ship people get off that boat and go in town, away from the crowds to this super amazing restaurant making everything from their own cured meats, fresh mozzarella and scratch made dough. The wines are good, service super friendly and they even have a cute little patio. The deli is right beside to hook up on great to go stuff. Get anything with the local basil. It packs a punch. 
Please follow @joannasable on instagram for more food and travel fun.

wow! They provide a really great dinner experience for us. We weren't sure what to expect, but by looking at the menu we knew it was going to be good. When we got there was even better than we could have expected. Such a family atmosphere, great wine, great food, and a really nice staff. We really enjoyed ourselves.

I felt like everything was there to make for a great experience. Great atmosphere, quality food and wine. They weren't very busy, yet the service was only so so. I rarely mention this kind of thing, but it was worth pointing out.

Not particularly impressed for lunch. Had the meatballs and they were very dense. Flavor was fine but nothing to write home about. Had to ask several times for salt and pepper. I've heard dinner is great but I didn't find anything special about the small lunch menu or food.

name: Pier 49
address: 406 S Franklin St Suite 102, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: This is a solid alternative to Tracy’s Crab Shack if the lines over there are turning you off.  You can get great Alaskan King Crab Legs, crab claws, soup and non seafood offerings. They also have mixed drinks and Alaskan beer.  They also have plenty of outside seating with a nice harbor (cruise ship) view.  Prices are high, but you are in Alaska and that is to be expected so be prepared.  Service was good and the food was served quickly and hot!

Great food, view and staff! King crab legs were so fresh, better than ones we had on a crab boat tour! Salmon wrap and buffalo burger were delicious as well. Staff was great and drinks were as well. The views from deck are beautiful and our boys enjoyed playing cornhole while waiting.

There are space heaters here to ward off the brisk Alaska air as well as a covered outdoor patio with plentiful seating.  The food came fast and hot.  I felt like the prices were reasonable and the staff was friendly as well.
Really enjoyed it. Our bus driver was a chief and he shared great stories. The movie was very interesting. Totems were beautiful. Sitka is a pretty town. Friendly people.

I ordered their salmon burger, Juneau Glow( a ginger beer drink) and Bear Creek Strawberry Rhubarb(a wine). 

-I don't like that neither the person preparing the meal or the person taking my order could describe what flavor components were  on  the burger and instead just tried to describe what salmon taste like. Saying that it's a "fishy fish". I think anyone ordering salmon knows what it taste like. I'm trying to know what  the burger will taste like after you put whatever you're going to on it. But they couldn't understand that for whatever reason. The cook even had a  confused look on her face, which I couldn't understand. I think it would be very odd if no one has ever come here wanting to know what's on or in their meal. But I decided to give it a try anyway since I had a taste for salmon.

-I felt that the salmon wasn't seasoned and that a lot more of the spread( whatever that may have been) should have been used on it.

-The beans were really good and very well seasoned. So it's a bit shocking that the salmon wasn't.

-The Juneau glow was one of the best drinks I've ever had in my life. I'm not a big drinker, I don't like regular beer and I don't like straight alcohol. I always go for a mixed drink and I was just saying earlier that day I want to find some ginger beer. So I was really happy when I saw this on the menu! It consists of lemon juice, blackberries, rose vodka and Ketel One Botanical grapefruit.

-The strawberry rhubarb wine was a little bit too sweet for my taste. (Not their fault)

I'd come back, I'd just try something else.

name: Kitchen of Thai Curries
reviews: Fabulous find. Quality Thai food at low to moderate prices. Favoured by locals. Friendly, fast service. Highly recommended.

My absolute favorite in downtown Juneau! Friendly, fast, delicious, and reliably excellent food and service. Great price for the amount of food they give you- I get 2-3 meals out of a full size curry.

Really unique setup and decor. Nice prices and good portions. I ordered the green curry shrimp.My only complaint is that they were skimpy with the shrimp. I only had three in my curry. 😒 The staff are also very friendly and polite.

In Juneau it's hard to find good service and bang for your buck when it comes to food. 

This was my first time stepping in and I was amazed by the prices and the servings. I got a large chicken yellow curry plate for 9 dollars and something and got more food then I could eat. I had to take some home.

Curry was incredible, serving size was shocking,  staff so accommodating, nice and polite.

I am a new regular.
Tasty selection of curries at a fair price. Large portions that are easy to split and take to-go. Options for everybody, including vegetarian and vegan.

name: Suwanna Thai Cafe
reviews: Nice little Tai spot. Great place if you want to pick up for take home or to go. Wouldn't dine in seating is very limited.
Great service, great prices, great food!! The only thing is stay away from is the spring rolls - not as good as the other meals/appetizers on the menu
Staff are friendly and the business is always clean. I can't complain about anything, its Thai(ish) food in Juneau.
I like the curry, but our group got split up and I had to wait to eat due to social pressure. Food was fast for me at least.
Friendly quick service, even when you come in 5 minutes before close! Love their summer rolls, super filling and very good.

name: Pucker Wilson's
reviews: Best burger and fries in Juneau. Can get pretty busy in the summer, best to get there a bit before the noon rush. They frequently have great specials (brisket philly cheese steak, pulled pork poutine, chicken gyro, etc). However my favorite is the Husky Dawson (burger with onion rings and bacon) and the 3-way fries (french fries, sweet potato fries, and fried brussels sprouts). Enough to feed 2 people. Friendly service. The owner is great and very personable. Prices are a little high, but worth it for the taste and quality of food.
Great food! Cowboy Sundae is wonderful! Short walk from the cruise ship docks.
Burger is good, fries not, sitting outside might be alright when it's not raining, but we live in a temperate rain forest where it rains almost every day.
Without question the best burger in Juneau. Deserves six stars.
Delicious food, good pricing and fast service.

name: Four Plates Cocina Peruana
reviews: The chicken stew plate was good!

We had a two hour layover in Juneau so we thought to walk somewhere for lunch. Took about ten minutes to walk there but was worth it. The bacon empanada was phenomenal. I assume it's a new item because it wasn't on the menu but it probably will be soon.  I also had the chicken stew thing and that was so flavorful and delicious. Definitely going there again next time I fly through.

Four plates has 4 main dishes on the menu, we ordered the first, a savory and simple chicken potato stew, served with rice. Everything was a huge portion, the staff were friendly and happy to answer questions. The dish was well seasoned, but didn’t have the intense flavors/spice of Mexican food, the potatoes and chicken were tender. We also had a Caesar salad (huge amount of salad) and a churro for dessert, all of which I would recommend.  I had no expectations and left very full and happy!
The service was amazing, and the food was unexpectedly delicious. The bacon empanada is to die for! I didn't experience anything here I didn't like. Perfect! Exactly what I want when I dine in.
Food is so flavorful! Two words BACON-EMPANADAS 😁

name: Canton Asian Bistro
address: 8585 Old Dairy Rd #105, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: If I lived in Juneau , I would happily go broke eating here every week. The staff is amazingly friendly and engaging and the atmosphere is wonderfully comfortable. A fusion of all things Asian, and uniquely Alaskan. The saki is good, sashimi is terrific. Tuna, salmon, snapper . Each with its own flavor and texture. This is a gem of a restaurant.

The sushi is really good. The only time I had a Chinese combination it wasn’t good. The sauce was way too sweet and tasted store bought. Its expensive for the sushi you get and customer service is a hit or miss.

ALOT of food was served, however we did not even eat half of what we were served because it wasn't very good. It was missing the flavor and spice that you typically get with a good Asian restaurant at this price point.

THIS IS very very good Chinese and their food could be in any big city!!! & we are from a big city in lower 48 .. we tried their California roll as appetizer .. it was very fresh & very good as well..I feel lucky to have this NICE restaurant in Juneau while we are here!!!!!!  AND ..Service was excellent!!  thank you all from the front walking in (hostess is so sweet) to the kitchen!  🥠🥟🥡 thumbs up!
This restaurant has a nice atmosphere and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The food is to die for and comes out in a very timely manner. A-1 traditional asian meals.

name: Juneau Pizza
reviews: Very good pizza and service. The food did not take long at all.
Best pizza in the valley. A bit higher in price but so worth the extra cost. Highly recommended.
It would be nice if the hours posted online were the actual store hours.  I have shown up twice to find that the restaurant isn't actually open even though the business hours online say it is.

Best pizza in Juneau. Owner operator chef serves a top quality pie with generous slices and sizes. 
Family style meals in a modest setting.
The best pizza in town homemade Juneau pizza made by Marine Brown and Laura Sheldon

name: El Sombrero
address: 157 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Excellent local Mexican joint. You don't go for the ambiance... You go for the huge servings and excellent food. Food is made to order fresh, customizable and amazing. Staff is friendly and fun. Price is good given the sizes. Salsa is some of the best we've had. Highly recommend.

Best Mexican food in Alaska and most probably north of Mexico!!! The last time I ate here was in 2006 and now in 2019 the food tastes the same :AWESOME!! Excellent service by staff! A happy place. And not expensive. I highly recommend this restaurant if you are ever in Juneau, Alaska. The last place you'd expect great Mexican food!
A wonderful service excellent food. Took real good care of us.
This is a great, quaint little Mexican restaurant I go to every time I go to Juneau. It's easy to walk to, has great service, and delicious food! I just wish their salsa was spicier.
My favorite restaurant ever. I will always get the #16 The Burrito Especial ♥️

name: La Salsa Mexican Food
reviews:
This food is great! Best Mexican in town without a doubt!

Best hot sauce ever too!

The folks that run it are super cool n nice too
Best mexican food in town, great prices and great service
This family run restaurant is second to none! They serve quality authentic Mexican cuisine at reasonable prices. The food is delicious and plentiful! I eat here whenever possible!
My favorite place to eat Mexican food in cheer now I love the super burrito and nachos and chicken wings
Surprisingly delicious. They also have a great red chilli sauce thumbs up!

name: Alaskan Crepe Escape
address: 356 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: I really liked the smoked salmon crepe. Plenty of filling in a soft and slightly sweet crepe with crispy edges. And it’s $2 off after 5 pm!
Absolutely amazing!! Fantastic customer service and the smoked salmon crepe is insanely delicious. Will definitely return. Highly recommend them.

I stop here every time I'm in Juneau. These crepes pack so much flavor and taste it's just amazing. Either you choose sweet or savory, you won't go wrong. Prices are a bit higher but it's worth every cent. Plus the service is fast and the girls are beyond nice and sweet.

Ooomyygoooshhh. Where have you been all my life....This was SOOOOO FREAKIIIIIINNNN GOOD!😋 I got the Gastineau( Which is a smoked salmon dip, topped with smoked salmon, red onions, spinach and cheese.) and it smells so freakin DELICIOUS! And it taste as good as it smells! I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND and REPURCHASE!  I'm sooo stuffed right now.😊

I only tried the Gastineau crepe which includes smoked salmon, spinach, and cream cheese and I would definitely go back for more if I ever visit Juneau again.  It was very filling and they don't skimp on the salmon!

name: Saffron Indian Comfort Cuisine
address: 112 N Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Awesome food and drinks at Juneau, Quality Indian foods, Delicious Atmosphere with Free Wi-Fi....

Delicious fare, excellent price. Probably the most economical meal I've had in Alaska. Convenient distance from hotels and downtown. Stellar customer service. Group of four ordered a variety of foods from the menu and all were pleased with the quality and taste of the food.
Very authentic cuisine. Friendly service and excellent food. Fair prices. Nice decor and music. Free WiFi. Great place for a date.

Good restaurant and great service. 
View is amazing and they do offer Buffet as well as a-la-carte service.
Very easily accessible and staff is friendly strategically located in busy official area so the clientele are very decent and you can enjoy quite meals.

One of my favorite restaurants in Juneau, true comfort food. The prices are about average or a little below average for this community. The food is really good, some items from the menu are better than others, I really like the paneer. The food is seasoned, as Indian food should be, but it's not too spicy for the kids. We order 3 small dishes to split between a family of four and leave with leftovers.

name: Asiana Gardens
address: 9116 Mendenhall Mall Rd, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: I visited Asiana Gardens for my first time this memorial day and had a wonderful experience! My server Kim(?) was very sweet and attentive. She suggest a wine and and a plate and I was happy with both! Thank you!
They misheard my to-go order and prepared the wrong menu item (probably my fault). They corrected it on the spot with no extra charge.  Excellent service and food. Great restaurant with great staff.
Staff very helpful, variety of food. Food came out fast and was good. Have a special birthday song for all yo hear.
Good food and pretty good customer service. Their lunch bowls are my favorite and they are a good deal.
great restaurant if you want lunch or dinner, with great prices , not very pricey.

name: Tracy's King Crab Shack 2
reviews:
Great for tourist, not locals.   Come here for lunch if you want to spend $$$.
Nice atmosphere, eat outside, inside tent is hot AF though.  Military discount ( but not applied).  
I recommend the crab bisque ($10), a roll, and an Alaksa Amber beer.  Nice, sweaty view.
The crab legs were wonderful. The bottle prices on wine we're reasonable. It's costly, but it's an experience.

Loved every bite of this establishment. Fresh food, large quantities with excellent service. Mini crab cakes were excellent along with the humongous crab legs. The crab bisque was to die for, bountiful chunks of crab fills every cup.
What a great place to get some delicious king crab.  Not nearly as busy as their other location. Plenty of seats, good looking location a little out of the way but worth the walk.
Excellent, giant King Crab legs.  Walk to the one on the edge of Juneau....much more scenic than the one downtown.

name: Valley Restaurant
reviews: Great place to eat, friendly staff, quick eats and generous portions.   Thanks valley restaurant for having great food for our short stay in Juneau.  Your restaurant will be on my list to visit my next trip to Juneau.
Amazing teriyaki chicken with a fried rice substitute. I like my meat saucy and they did not disappoint. also my girlfriend Hannah says ‘good atmosphere’

We ate breakfast here.  We got the breakfast garbage plate which was big enough for two people.  Think breakfast skillet.  We enjoyed it; I'd order it again.  The place isn't fancy, but it's got local look and feel.  No experience with lunch or dinner choices.

My husband & I have eaten here numerous times in the past 3 weeks & I seriously think that their FRIED RICE (I've had pork & shrimp) is the best I've EVER had!!  My husband gets the ham & cheese or bacon & cheese omelets & he said awesome as well!!  Their hashbrowns are outstanding in taste..I know because I eat his!! The service from the ladies in this place is VERY good as well .. very attentive .. like the review above me says .. it's a homey kinda lil town place but if you are looking for a reasonable $ meal (hello Juneau 😳) this is your place!! i highly recommend!! yum
Good food reasonably priced

name: Grumpy's Delicatessen
address: 175 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: One of my favorite things about Grumpys is the website name. Next favorite would have to be the chicken bacon ranch wrap.

Friendly service, nice selection of a variety of food, and well lit and pretty decor.  Prices are higher than a dive dinner, but the ingredient quality, particularly for the smoothies and juices, is as good as you're going to find commercially in Juneau.  Oh, and tasty!
Solid sandwich option downtown with seating
Love this place and how the owners are there taking care of their customers! Thank Andy and Jamie for being SO awesome!

Grumpy's is amazing. Get the Andy's Pastrami with horseradish and pickles. Also, their juices & smoothies are the best in town. Great location, quick service, friendly people, wonderful food -- what's not to love?

name: Poki Poki
address: 172 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Great poki, quiet spot.

Came here in the afternoon during the summer. Place was dead. Ordered a pokebowl. Nothing fancy. Half the fish was frozen. For a place by the water can they not get fresh fish? That's really important when serving raw fish. 

Otherwise the place was clean, and staff friendly.
The food is aways fresh, the employees are super friendly, and I always feel good after eating there. The prices are good for how much you get. Definitely recommend
I love the food and love the service. Always friendly and personable.
Amazing food and excellent service.

name: Devil's Club Brewing Company
address: 100 N Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: As someone who travels most of the year for work, I am always interested in local beer culture when visiting. Found this downtown microbrewery on a snowy Sunday when in Juneau for work. Small food menu, but the pretzel with beer cheese and bbq pork sliders were both tasty. Staff was very friendly and the vibe was warm despite the frigid temps outside. I am not sure how it is when the cruise ship mobs are in town, but on a quiet, snowy Sunday, it was a great find after a 10 hour travel day!

Good company can be enjoyed with good beer in this renovated theater turned brewery. They mostly serve beer, but there is also food to purchase. 
I believe Devil’s Club is quickly outgrowing their current space as there are often many people at all times, but that’s also a testament to their local popularity. 🍻

There is an unexpected treat for beer lovers in Juneau and it’s The Devil’s Brewing Co. on Franklin St. 

The Devil’s Brewing Co. is a 21st century brew pub with a polite staff, who is highly educated about beer. With gleaming blond wood surfaces, the pub’s industrial feel and gender indifferent bathrooms make this Brewing Co. feel plucked right out of a big city. 

Check out the board for the names of the beers on offer. Or for an even better description ask the staff. You will be treated to a surprisingly knowledgeable and descriptive account of each variety. 

Make certain to include a stop at The Devil’s Club Brewing Co. as a part of your Juneau excursion. 

TheBillo313

Came in off a cruise ship. Very impressed by their selection of beers and food. Pretzel and beer cheese is amazing! Area has lots of seating and can be a quick stop on your day in Juneau. Highly recommend!

I liked all of their beers and the food we had was great! Get the pretzel and beer cheese, the chips and salsa, and the popcorn. But really everything is good here. The problem is it gets hot in here. Was 77 outside. They have fans to help move the air but on a summer day in Juneau it didnt feel like enough.

name: Little Tokyo Juneau
reviews: Little Tokyo always has good food, plus the tea and soup is always hot. 🍵 🍣 🥢
The service was overly pushy and gave us little to no time to find out what we wanted. Also the sushi was very middle of the road, not bad but nothing spectacular.
Fairly good sushi. Haven't been to any other Japanese restaurants in Juneau but they seem to have decent food. Not far from the cruise ships.
Best place for sushi
The Las Vegas Sushi Roll is absolutely phenominal.

name: Lemon Tree Café
reviews: This is probably my number one food spot in Juneau. Food is excellent, service is friendly, and food comes out quick, hot, and fresh. Favorites include the old friend noodle soup, chicken steam buns, and cold noodle salad. Only cons are that the seating is very limited (get there early for lunch) and the cafe is insufferably hot. Cannot recommend enough.

I am so glad I found this place.  I ordered the spicy beef noodle soup, curry chicken, and shrimp dumplings.  They were all amazing and was given a steam bbq bun as a compliment.  I will definitely come here again when I visit Juneau.  It’s a small little restaurant right in downtown Juneau and parking was a little hard but I found a paid to park just up the street.  The waitress was super sweet.  You order up at the counter, grab your own drink from the cooler and the food is brought to your table.  I want to try the Beef Stew Rice and the Bun Cha next time I am here.
Great family run restaurant. I had the Old Friend Noodle soup. It was spicy and loaded with meat, tofu and noodles. I’m looking forward to going back and trying something else.
Nice traditional portions, good flavor and (But not as flavorful as others I've had.)  cheap. I ordered the tofu noodle bowl.
Love this place! It is my favorite place to go on dates with my grandson.

name: Mar y Sol Mexican Food
address: 617 W Willoughby Ave, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: My first time eating from here and all I think about is the money I've wasted cooking when I could have spent it here. Im writing this as I eat my tacos because they are amazing and deserved a 5star rating immediately. They are delicious and cooked perfectly. Everything from the onions to the lime and green salsa this is exactly what I was wanting. Thank you. I will definitely come back.

What they offered was alright, but I love a good Al Pastor, a marinated succulent pork when not overcooked, not on their menu, or a tasty sopa, a Mexican soup, not on their menu.

The quality is good, but in this catagory, I would like to taste a great, tasty Al Pastor burrito.
Amazingly delicious and authentically Mexican food! You will not go wrong with any dish that you choose! Absolute favorite. I recommend this establishment to everyone!
Love their authentic street taco fare. I wish we had even more options like from back home, like Tripe, etc. Their lengua is great though!

This place is absolutely immaculate! The ambiance was next level. I felt like a was in a mexican romance novel with my boyfriend. The wait responed non verbal dinning cues like sticking the menus out to the side and noticed as soon as we finished out water. THEY HAVE A HOMEMADE SAUCE BAR. GO NOW ITS THE BEST!

name: Bernadette's Fast Food
address: 225 Front St STE 101, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: Bbq and dinuguan is the best you can eat in Bernadette's Fast Food. Amazingly located in Juneau Alaska. Thanks to cruise ship and because of pinoy seaman crew members who missed so much eating pinoy dishes the only place I go since before is this fast food. They have a satellite food stall by the park where most Filipino crew members are lining up to have their popular bbq combo either shanghai with dinuguan even with papaitan. Even foreign nationals or American are curious to have the bbq as the smoke smells all over the place. They also sometimes have free donuts or desserts that make you surprise. Wifi is also available and other filipino dishes are also served. Please come visit Them!
Love the ethnic cuisine, diversity, smells and flavors best place ever to eat " spicy squid "*****
Indonesian and Philippines food good for them and tasty cuisine
Very good restaurant
Hella good

name: Douglas Cafe
reviews: Pricey for a burger joint diner but food and service was awesome and quick
Good times with friends and the people there treat you like family!! 😊
Amazing breakfast. Their special skillet is well worth trying out and while I had never heard of a breakfast version of fried rice it was awesome. Service was very personable too.
Cozy place with great food and pleasant service.
Great staff, delicious food, quant setting.

name: Korea Garden
reviews: I'm on a plant base diet and found something on the menu for me to eat. I had the vegetables over white rice which was amazing!

Their meatball pho was very good and tasty.

The chef/cook doesn't have the basic cooking skills mastered: cooking protein.  The shrimp in their tempura was overcooked, rubbery.  To add insult to injury, they served the rubbery, overcooked tempura with sweet and sour sauce instead of a tempura dipping sauce.  How unauthentic and a disgraceful to Japanese cuisine.

The same people also own Asians Garden in the valley, and Little Tokyo also downtown a short distance away.  The same low bar - overcooked protein, pork in the katsu.  If you have no connotation, ignorant, or just don't care, come over and dine at this inferior establishment in ignorant bliss.
I am loving it. Nice Sushi. Friendly staff. I love the fortune cookies. The food is nice. Nice place to have a friendly meet. Sushi is the best!!!! Must try when you are in Juneau.
The location is easy to find. The food are so delicious but my favourite are the meatball. The owner are friendly. And they have a strong wifi as well.

Excellent! Had the Bento box with Bulgogi, tempura shrimp, deep fried pot stickers, japcha, salad and steamed rice. Hit the spot for my Asian cravings. Fast service and polite server! So happy I went there 😊

name: Raven Cafe
reviews: Good spicy pork adobo. Pretty fast to serve too.

After visiting for an event at APK aka Alaska State Museum, the Raven Cafe is inside the museum building.  Ordered a pork (or chicken) adobo burrito mild, comes with sour cream, garlic rice.  Delicious, tasty, moist, succulent pork, not overcooked.  And a mocha coffee.  A burrito with a Filipino taste, great place too go, share a meal with a friend or loved one.
We had a great barbecue sandwich and drinks! A very nice couple runs the cafe, supplying good food and friendly smiles. We were pleasantly surprised by the food and friendliness.
Great food! Nice people!
Awesome food and excellent service!

name: Chan's Thai Kitchen
reviews: While it may not look like a 5 star restaurant, the food is AMAZING and their Thai ice tea is the best in all of Juneau
Great Thai food made to order. Best in Juneau! Try the spring rolls. Since everything is made to order can get backed up, but your patience is rewarded with great food!
Great food, great prices, huge portions !

Good service and amazing portions. You could have several meals from one order which makes it a good value. The food isn't amazing but it's good enough. Plus you can eat looking out at the views of Alaska which is something in itself. I think if a family was hungry after whale watching or fishing this would be a great place to grab a quick bite.
Best Thai food in Alaska!!! I don't let family leave Juneau without going to Chan's at least once. The chicken satay with added spice is my favorite.

name: El Zarape
reviews: Awesome food. My smothered burrito was big enough for two meals! And tasted great!  Just what I needed today. A new favorite place. Thanks!

This is the best Mexican food I have had in the state of Alaksa. They are not going to win a decor award, but the best places never do. They could serve their food anywhere and it would speak for itself, it's just that good. Very authentic and homemade flavor!
Very good authentic food. Super nice folks. The view outside was incredible.
Best authentic Mexican food in town. They have awesome customer service and warm environment. If I had a complaint it would be the parking situation but that's all I could say negatively about it.
That hot sauce went deliciously with my enchiladas. Good portion size for lunch or dinner.

name: The Hot Bite
address: 11445 Auke Bay Harbor Rd, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews:
Local restaurant located in the marina.  Burgers are good milkshakes of all flavors . Outside seating to watch the boats come in.
 Two young eagles on the dock.

I was disappointed in every aspect of this establishment. The restrooms were atrocious, the service was sub par, the burger was mediocre. They were out of several items. The food was overpriced for the quality.

The quality of food has dropped the last couple of years. I'd only stop in if I was craving a milkshake, but everything is too overpriced for me to be a regular. Plus, they're only open during the summer. It would be great to have a good burger option in the university campus area.
Best place in southeast AK for burgers and shakes.
Always renowned and authentic.  Classic burgers and fries with real milkshakes. Old fashioned style and service.

name: Bowl of Pho
reviews: This place is so good! Like 10/10 would recommend. The food was not only delicious but also presented very well. I forgot to take pictures before we started because it looked so good!

Dishes weren’t clean, server was talking on his phone while taking our order, didn’t even bother to count our change correctly, AND offered to bribe us with a discount if we left a good review. Table was sticky, sauces on the table were left open and had dried remnants from previous uses, server didn’t come back to check on us once and we had to ask for the check. The only thing good about this place were the rabbits on the tv. Food was okay but definitely not worth the trip.
Friendly and timely service. Food was delicious, great flavors. Nice addition to the juneau food scene
Really good pho! Wish they had more vegetarian options
Great customer service and food was wonderful.

name: The Udder Culture featuring Aurora Sweets
address: 9105 Mendenhall Mall Rd # 146, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: I had a fluke a couple minutes ago with Door Dash where over an hour had gone by and my order hadn't even been received yet. I called the restaurant directly and the sweet woman over the phone was nice enough to take my order for me, discounted an item after the side dish I wanted was no longer available, and offered to deliver it to me after they closed for the day so I still got my food. I was so happy with the service, I had to give them a review. Thanks for helping extending help to us locals at such a trying time in our world!

Udder Culture best deal is their half a sandwich and a cup of soup daily special.  You may order generally any two meats, two cheeses, exception of bacon, a refill on your cup of soup until they run out, so to get the best possibility, come by 13:00 as their soups run out.  They have shrimp croissant on Wednesdays and Fridays.  They have nonfat or lowfat frozen yogurt.  Baked potato is available.

My sandwich could have been better, but the service was nice. I like the updated decor and food options. I was afraid the Udder Culture vibe would be lost with the new owners, but it's pretty much stayed the same. Except the milkshakes aren't the same.

So I have to start by saying this review is over 20 years in the making. I moved to Juneau in 1993 and sometime there after I had the creamy split pea soup and it changed my life. I, literally, to this day remark about that split pea soup. No split pea soup has ever compared to it. I am reviewing the cafe from when I knew it. But reading reviews it sounds like its the same. Kudos to you guys! I've traveled the world now and can say I STILL have not had a better split pea soup.
Smashing! Great Food and Excellent Customer Service. I'll definitely make it a point to come back again. Highly recommended.

name: Juno Froyo
address: 8585 Old Dairy Rd #103, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: I am not a huge fan of frozen yogurt. I did get a custard option, however it wasn't great. On the other hand, the toppings selection is without compare. So many choices for what to add to your sweet treat. Great place to take the kids!
Nice place w/a decent selection of flavors. Very clean on the inside, and cashiers are usually cheerful.
Delicious ice cream & frozen yogurt with chill atmosphere and friendly staff.
Great staff/owner. Obviously, good frogurt!
Great variety of flavors and toppings, friendly service. It really hit the spot!

name: Timberline Bar & Grill Atop Mount Roberts
reviews: A lovely little nature centre atop Mount Roberts, great for short tours and day trips. The walking trails are very interesting and we even got to see a porcupine. Our tour guide Lars was very helpful and made the tour incredibly entertaining. The theatre has a short film the plays for free and the gift shop is better than most. The spiced apple cider was great and we even got to try some of the local jams and teas.
Hidden gem ! Really great food and lots to explore! Definitely recommend this place but plan to bring an empty stomach!
It was very wooded place and worth going up there for wide open view.

Interesting place. Allow extra time to get back as the return line is longer at lunch time.  Views from the restaurant are limited and service can be slow. Nice film and intro about the native tribes. We did not have time to check out the trails, wishes we did. This is owned by the natives / locals so they need your support.
Loved it! Beautiful views! Halibut fish and chips was excellent and blueberry pie!

name: The Grind Coffee
reviews: Thank you ladies for an excellent cup of coffee! Hot or iced, both delicious :)
Good service and great coffee
Best coffeee amazing staff
Honest and friendly
Best coffee in Juneau!

name: Subway
reviews: Hmmm, where to start: the employees are sometimes rude depending on who you catch on a given day/time, the food makes me sick for some reason, and overall, I wouldn't recommend this Subway. The downtown Subway seems to be a smidgen better than this one as far as quality of food and customer service.

these folks should get an award!! Hands down the best service i have EVER had at any subway and just about any restaurant.  the line out the door took 5 minutes to check out w food in hand. and it was perfect.
The redhead With the mustache was very nice and very helpful

2 days in a row using the app to order. Mistake. Sub last night was ordered with 2x veggies came light. So today upon ordering a wrap I asked at pickup if the 2x veggies was given and told I dont know and we cant open to check. No surprise light veggies and no cheese. Last time using this location. Surprised at the lack of training.
Staff was great

name: Buoy Deck
reviews: Awesome place to hang out and enjoy a beverage. I didn't try the food, the view is great and the bartender was awesome.

note: Military ID required or civilian can be accompanied by military personnel

Great food, five rotating Alaskan Brewing drafts and five other drafts, nice view of the Gastineau Channel, darts, pool tables, shuffleboard, and foosball.
Love this low-key bar. Great cheap eats, great cheap beers. Great on weekdays to bring your kids since its so slow. I love this bar.
Great beer, great food, and the friendliest staff I've encountered so far in Juneau!
Good food, well priced drinks and a cute staff.

name: The Hangar On The Wharf
address: 2 Marine Way Ste 106, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews:
I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant.  Wow, what a fantastic dinner and introduction to fresh, Alaskan seafood.  Honestly, I was served the best Fish n Chips I've ever had, hands down.  

My son had some incredible, sweet and creamy oysters on the half shell, and coconut shrimp which was crispy and delicious.  My other son who is not a seafood fan, enjoyed a grass fed, organic burger, every last bite.  

It can be a little busy with 5 cruise ships in port in this tiny town of Juneau, Alaska's capitol city, but the staff work together like a well oiled machine and to ensure your meal is timely, hot, fresh and delicious.

Appears as just another cruise ship shakedown restaurant but our experience was way better.  Lovely fresh fish and views.  Plenty of gluten free options.  Fast service.  Views.  Good for children.  Has highchairs.
Great service. Delicious food. Perfect for the end of the night treat. Thank you so much Hanger staff! Great job all around.

Without exception, the best halibut chowder, for that matter any chowder, we've ever had anywhere in the world. No exaggeration. Service was great. View of the water and ships accentuated a wonderful family dining experience.

Soup is hot, beer nice and cold. Great selection, easygoing staff, lots of seating, great view. Nice to see the action in the kitchen. Bar menu and regular menu. Good specials. Always parking. Historical building.

name: Twisted Fish Company Alaskan Grill
address: 550 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: My brothers and I had a great time dining outside at the Twisted Fish! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved the waiter she laughed and joked with everyone at our table. She made our experience delightful.

What a wonderful experience.  The food was plentiful and ferociously delicious and the service (despite being crammed from ships entering port) was spot on!   Get the full pound of crab legs so you don't leave wanting more!!!

We had a quick stop in Juneau before a helicopter tour and it being my first time on a helicopter and not sure if I’d make it back in one piece, we decided on Twisted Fish for lunch beforehand in case it ended up being our last meal. It was delicious! I love a lemon butter caper sauce and the chef prepared it with halibut by request and it did not disappoint. After conquering my fear of getting on a helicopter (and safely landing), we decided to go back the same night for dinner. This time we celebrated with Alaskan king crab, cocktails and dessert. OMG the crab was amazing!! It’s definitely on the pricey side compared to back home but it was so worth it. Highly recommend getting the crab.

Food 5/5 service 2/5 The food was very good and the portions were very large. We shared an appetizer and an entree. The crab and artichoke dip was amazing the baguette was soft and perfectly toasted. The halibut burger was very fresh and super delicious! The service was mediocre, the patio was not that busy but we didn't get our waters refilled and our food was delivered with out cutlery.

A must dine experience in Juneau! For the view and the menu!  Grilled fresh Alaskan catch cannot be beat! Bling Blinky of TEXAS ?Shout Out: Right off of the ship walk on over on the cruise ship docks and take a seat! Loved it!

name: Forno Rosso
address: 356 S Franklin St, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: We ate at Forno Rosso for lunch in Juneau Alaska while there on a cruise ship stop. The pizza was incredibly delicious. They use the freshest ingredients (vegetables and/or meats), all locally sourced. Pizzas are cooked in a wood-burning oven and the flavors are delectable. A must visit place for a bite when in Juneau. We will definitely return.

Amazing pizza! Go here and get the crab or reindeer pizza, they are incredible. 

Its actually a food truck on the other side of the road from where this shows.
Soggy pizza.
Hey that's pretty good

name: Devils Hideaway
reviews: Great dive bar restaurant combo that has pretty good burgers and fried halibut. Great prices for Alaska and a terrific view. Pool darts and corn hole. The bar is Squirez and the food service is Devil's Hideaway....two separate places. Great bartenders.

GREAT GOOD and drinks. I was visiting for a week from California. My buddy from Juneau's Hidden History said it was the best burger and wings place in town. And boy was he right!!! I requested that we go back another 2 more times to get the "3Bs" burger! Sooo good!
Great cheeseburgers!  Halibut or shrimp baskets recommended too.
Food's good. Good music. Nice view.

Cozy little locals place with Killer food and View of Auke Bay Marina.  Try the Triple B burger, Bourbon BBQ sauce, Bacon, Avacado, Blue Cheese Burger with their special Tots!  This is a cozy bar atmosphere with a side grill, a great casual place. Ignore the Anti 5-Star reviews and come as you are for some Great Eats & Enjoy the VIEW!

name: Northern Cuisine
reviews: Best new breakfast place in Juneau.  Very clean and neat kitchen and staff prompt service.  I ordered chicken fried steak it was hands down the best I've had in Juneau.  The steak was cooked perfectly with a crunch and the country gravy with sliced smoked sausage took it over the top.  Hash browns were crunchy eggs over easy toast and coffee  were perfect hot and delicious...

Breakfast and lunch served from 0600 to 1400, dinner served Sunday through Thursday from 1700-2100, Friday and Saturday 1700-2200.  Alcohol purchases are charged on a separate credit card charge only for the reason the Frontier Suites Hotel holds the beer and wine license.

Enter the restaurant through the Frontier Suites lobby immediately to your left.  Check to see what their white board specials are upon entering.  One of the white board specials is pork liempo never heard of before, pork belly that's succulent.  It came with pancit, rice, and supposedly lumpia which didn't come and I didn't noticed until later reviewing my photographs.  There was chicken breast meat in the pancit that was overcooked, dry.  The white rice was nice and fluffy though brown rice is healthier.
It was good I'll definitely go back!
Wonderful service, quick and delicious.

name: Costco Food Court
reviews: Unhealthy food except the salad, tables to stand by or sit outside while consuming your food.  Hot dog and soda for a great price.

The customer service is spot on but it often takes 10-15 minutes to get to the front of the line. Way too long for a lunch break. 

If management could hire additional staff, adapt the new computer ordering system (like anchorage), or did another way to save time it would be well appreciated.
Costco food court has the best prices on hot dogs in town. Dollar fifty plus a soft drink can't beat it.
Very good food.
The food is great for what you pay. It's a small food court, way smaller than what you would find in other stores down south.

name: Sacred Grounds
reviews: Great coffee and I like the discount for bringing your own cup.  If you forget it, they do use biodegradable cups.   I wonder if they will start composting soon???
Best coffee I have had in Juneau. Friendly service.

I came in at 7:00 to get coffee and a breakfast sandwich. I was told the cook wouldn't be there for a half hour. I ordered a coffee and waited. After a half hour I ordered a sandwich and sat down and waited. After 15 minutes I came back to ask what happened to the sandwich. It was sitting on the shelf getting cold. No one called me to pick it up nor did they deliver it to me. No apology. No compensation. Worst of all, they already got their tip as you have to add a tip when you pay up front. The coffee was okay. The sandwich was tasty (would have been nicer to eat it fresh) so I'll give two stars. They really need to improve customer experience. I won't be back.

Customer service and drink consistency could use a bit of work, but overall the place has a nice vibe to it.
It would be much better if you could get the staff to open their doors on time. I counted 8 people walk away the other morning because the girl working inside didn't unlock the front door. Finally, Melissa, another employee who was on crutches at the time, went over and opened the door and started greeting the people waiting...half an hour after the shop was supposed to be open. 
It could be a fluke, but it seems pretty bad to me when someone on crutches, that's not even scheduled to be working that day, has to hobble over and struggle to do your job for you. Nice Job Melissa! Hire more people like her!

I am an educator, producer, and entrepreneur. I have a BFA, MS, and numerous credentials. My boyfriend and I walked into this coffee shop to buy something to drink and use WiFi as we are on a cruise and were walking around Juneau checking out the sites. As my boyfriend was still using the wifi I accidentally drifted off to sleep. A police officer came up to us, demanded if we had bought something and told us we could not lounge or sleep. I apologized to him in that it was an accident. He was very rude and I would hate to think his approach was because we were people of color. We were the only people of color in the shop. We do not look homeless at all. Pretty cool shop, but the obvious disrespect and possible racism we just experienced is unacceptable. Please advise when making your decision to visit this establishment.

name: Manila Bay Cafe
address: 310 S Franklin St STE 300, Juneau, AK 99801, USA
reviews: 😁 The most popular diner among Filipino crews in any cruise ship while at this port of call.
Boba drinks are not a slush or worth 5.00. I was disappointed
Great boba slushes, A+ burgers, got to eat in a tent

I walked up and tried to decide what I wanted. I got a dumpling with meat in it and it was delicious, but I was appalled at the price, I also received a Thai tea and if you've had Thai tea around Juneau AK you know good Thai tea and this tea was just gross, and so not worth the price. Lastly and sadly I love lumpia and this was the most pitiful lumpia as the vegetables outweighed the meat. It comes with 2 for 3$ and some change took a bite and was disappointed to find no meat at all and what little bits of ground beef I hardly had. Would not recommend eating here.
Great burger
